author: {'steamid': '76561198027717869', 'num_games_owned': 384, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 1067, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1044, 'last_played': 1660335508}
review:
Starts off a little too slow for my taste but if you stick with it, it becomes interesting once you start getting some runes you can use.

Unfortunately you can quickly create spells that literally clear an entire screen full of enemies and actually one-shot even the final boss without even draining half your mana. So it could use some rebalancing in that regard, but it's still an enjoyable time-sink if you don't think about it too hard.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031601206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 846, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 846, 'last_played': 1509636341}
review:
This game has some truly awesome potential that's wasted by bugs and badly made gameplay elements that ruin it quickly. Examples include :

- The At Once rune is broken : one particular challenge that requires the At Once rune and above all requires some careful positioning to aim fireballs that go in an arc and backwards is rendered impossible due to the At Once rune completely messing with the starting direction of the spells. Something as simple as casting several spells in a row with the same starting conditions was failed. Simply unbelievable.

- Having to mash a button to break free from freezing effects : mechanics that require button mashing have already become a no-no a long time ago. Having to mash a button normally unused in combat to break free from an effet that freezes you on place and, worse, can be re-applied immediatly after breaking free ? That's pure unfairness. Simply having the freeze effect last a set duration would be enough, and letting the player react to the next potentially freezing attack before getting frozen again would make the game actually fair, rather than having some useless breaking-free animation that prevents the player from even raising a shield.

- Those goblin lightning spearmen are insane : as if splash damage on ranged attacks didn't make the game hard enough, get ready for a ranged attack that splits into 4 bolts that go in 4 separate perpendicular directions, are insanely fast, have no range limit, penetrate shields and above all have a totally random pattern. What makes a game of this kind fair is enemies having a degree of predictability. Being hit by an attack must be mainly the player's fault for not paying attention, not an occurence of pure randomness.

- A bug that simply makes a boss disappear and denies you of any rewards for beating it : at least it didn't prevent the story to continue, but still, having the boss simply disappear befire then end of the fight and neither getting the achievement and the upgrade to health and mana is infuriating. When the game auto-saves and the only way to get them is to start all over again, that's when you want to throw your controller through your monitor.

Badly programmed mechanics, unfair fights and bugs that potentially break the game, I cannot recommend it unless it gets patched to fix this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969364344', 'num_games_owned': 1670, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 1050, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1027, 'last_played': 1518499540}
review:
TL;DR: Zelda with a splash of Magicka.

Slightly longer: if you like Zelda games, you'll almost certainly like this. You have no melee weapons; even your melee is a spell. And like in Magicka, you get to "assemble" your spells from pieces. This gives you a fair amount of flexibility to play the way you want, although most of these things are unlocked gradually.

The graphics are gorgeous, the story is actually decent if unoriginal (the in-game lore is actually great, though!)

Polish-wise, I could almost believe this was from a AAA studio. I didn't encounter a single memorable bug my whole playthrough. (Worst thing that happened is I got stuck once)

Highly recommend, even at full price.

C'est dommage j'aurais aimÃ© que Ã§a dure plus longtemps. Du coup espÃ©rons une suite. RecommandÃ©.

-- Edit 13/11/2017 --

J'ai oubliÃ© d'en parler mais le jeu recommande l'utilisation d'une manette. HonnÃªtement je n'en vois pas l'utilitÃ©. Le jeu est parfaitement fluide avec le maniement clavier + souris.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151014665', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1651, 'last_played': 1508620389}
review:
Pros:
Nice world
Nice game design
Interesting spell design
Enjoyable puzzels and dungeons

Cons:
A few minor bugs
Enemies are not very diverse 

I played through this game twice (one playthrough for each mode) and had a lot of fun beating it. Even tough there are still some bugs in this game even after the updates. For example, sometimes a spell just keeps being in your list eventhough you deleted it and it will keep popping up no matter what. Also i completed the game both times a 100%, but through bugs i didnÂ´t get the achievement, or sometimes i collect a purple orb but the game doesnÂ´t register it. Also some of the puzzels are a little buggie and i beat one or two by acciedent because an orb glitched through a wall or something like that.
All in all itÂ´s a fun game for every age. You can just relax and play it, solve some puzzels and enjoy a nice little tale. The game design is also quite nice, your characater becomes stronger through the game by getting new modifikations for your spells, more Mana and more Life. 
If you are looking for a neat little game for the side this game is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975895891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 425, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1508001124}
review:
Ist das Spiel schlecht? Nein, ist es wirklich nicht.
WÃ¼rde ich das Spiel aber einem Freund empfehlen? Nein. Vielleicht aber fÃ¼r dessen Kinder.


Das Spiel wirkt von Beginn an so als hÃ¤tte das Spiel viel besser und interessanter sein kÃ¶nnen. 
Optisch ist der Stil inzwischen extrem ausgelutscht und die meisten Spiele wirken damit immer irgendwie etwas "meh", egal wie gut der Rest dahinter ist. Die KÃ¤mpfe kÃ¶nnen dem ganzen Magie-System leider kein StÃ¼ck gerecht werden.

Das Magic-System ist echt gelungen. Es erinnert sehr entfernt an Magicka, aber ohne den ganzen Chaos-Faktor. Mages of Mystralia bringt Ordnung in das Magie-System und das ist echt gut so. Das Spiel kÃ¶nnte das System schneller einfÃ¼hren, aber das System lÃ¤dt immerhin zum experimentieren ein. Leider bleibt es bloÃŸ bei einer Einladung. Wie bei Metal Gear Solid 5 kÃ¶nnte man das Spiel bloÃŸ mit den normalen Angriffen durchspielen und zwingt den Spieler kaum mal was anderes auszuprobieren. Die RÃ¤tsel erfordern aber immerhin den Einsatz der Runen zum VerÃ¤ndern der Grund-SprÃ¼che.



Der Rest vom Spiel ist relativ belanglos nett  ( Story, Spielwelt, Design, Chars, Sound usw.) und da liegt das Problem. Das Magie-System sollte mehr gefordert werden, viel mehr Bedeutung in den KÃ¤mpfen haben und die Inszenierung sollte einfach ein wenig aufwendiger gestaltet werden. Das Intro-Video deutet ebenfalls schon an, dass hier mehr gegangen wÃ¤re mit ein wenig mehr Aufwand.

Ich habe mich leider die meiste Zeit beim spielen gelangweilt und hab stÃ¤ndig gehofft, dass das gewisse etwas noch kommen wÃ¼rde, aber leider kam das nicht.

Mit einem Koop-Modus wÃ¼rde ich mich eventuell eher mit dem Spiel anfreunden kÃ¶nnen, aber als jetzt aktuelle Singleplayer-Erfahrung bleibt das Spiel unter seinen MÃ¶glichkeiten und leidet an der belieben Optik. Das Sequel kÃ¶nnte gut werden, wenn man sich den Negativpunkten annimmt, denn das GrundgerÃ¼st ist gar nicht so schlecht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082219377', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1507986488}
review: The story and gameplay is so addicting it pulls you right in! This cute game is not only worth your time but your money as well! There are two difficulties, playing for the story and playing for the challenge. I did playing for the story and i came close to dieing a couple times but over all it was pretty easy, relaxing, and laid back! I loved it! But there is that harder difficulty if you need to spice things up! Give this game a chance! If not full price then pick it up on a sale because either way it's worth it! The story and dialogue is what made this game so amazing for me!

author: {'steamid': '76561198052511058', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1507427456}
review:
I was cleaning out my bag when I found a button from this game I had been given at Pax. 
It has always looked cute but I have to admit I bought it due to the genuine heart and love that the person working their booth had for the game. 

It reminds me a lot of old RP adventure ps1 and n64 games. The spell creation concept is pretty great however I do feel like I can get by using the same 8 spells. This would be a cute and fun game for all ages. There's a lot of heart but not a lot of depth story wise. Well worth a play through and it's great for kids as it encourages creative problem solving.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073585214', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1067, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1593366422}
review: This game is abolutely amazing. A game design master piece which allow so many different playstyles feels very satisfying. A gigantic possibility of builds makes the ''Become a spellmaster'' headline much more meaningful, you actually have to learn a lot of combinations to unlock the full potential of your spells. I'm looking forward to a multiplayer version (Co-op missions or something) that could be a really cool feature added to the game. I would also love to see a DLC with new areas, puzzles and monsters to fight.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026214575', 'num_games_owned': 524, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1508011576}
review:
Estou me forÃ§ando a escrever uma anÃ¡lise desse jogo porque a maioria dos sites, mesmo aqueles que abordam games indies, ignoraram-no. Isto Ã© uma lastima visto se tratar de um game muito bem feito e polido, e que provavelmente deu prejuÃ­zo ao estÃºdio.

Mages of Mystralia se trata de um rpg em terceira pessoa bastante inspirado em games como Zelda e Fable. Apesar de ter tido o Ed Greenwood na equipe, lendÃ¡rio autor de muitos livros de Dungeons and Dragons, a histÃ³ria do game Ã© bem descartÃ¡vel, com o ponto forte ficando nos elementos de jogabilidade, grÃ¡ficos e qualidade sonora.

O sistema de magias pode ser apontado como uma inovaÃ§Ã£o. Ele lembra um pouco o sistema do game Magicka, onde a partir da combinaÃ§Ã£o de elementos sÃ£o criadas magicas com diferentes efeitos. O problema aqui Ã© que muitos puzzles - na maioria de acender braseiros ou pisar em chapas, depende que vocÃª use a magia certa (que Ã s vezes nÃ£o teve a criatividade de criar). Isto deixa o game meio cansativo eventualmente.

Apesar de bonitinho, sem bugs e polido Ã© um game que nÃ£o encanta. Pouco imersivo, Ã© como se fosse aquela pessoa que vocÃª considera bonita, mas que nÃ£o te dÃ¡ tesÃ£o. Uma pena. Muitos games conseguem contar uma histÃ³ria com uma narrativa nÃ£o verbal â€“ Zelda e o Hob conseguem isso. Mages of Mystralia, nÃ£o. Malmente vocÃª vai conseguir se lembrar sequer do nome da protagonista.

Nota: 7,5.

IMPORTANTE: AtÃ© dÃ¡ para se jogar o game com teclado, mas diria que o controle de XboX Ã© indispensÃ¡vel.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971012846', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1030, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1030, 'last_played': 1506839754}
review: A truly excellent game.  First impressions may be that it's simply a Zelda clone - well done, at that.  If it stopped there, that would still be high praise.  However, the game definitely has it's own voice in telling a simple but very enjoyable story.  The spell mechanics truly make the game shine.  Both incredibly original and incredibly fun, building your own combination of powers to make your own flavour of spells is a satisfaction in and of itself.    There is a great enjoyment in using these spells to defeat enemies and solve puzzles.  There's a lovely world to explore and hidden secrets to solve or discover, but not so immense that you completely lose track of the story or what you're supposed to be doing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970754349', 'num_games_owned': 818, 'num_reviews': 302, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1506486948}
review:
Mages of Mystralia is a fantastically designed game in both game design and complexity. The spell combinations are almost endless, but the game does a good job slowly introducing different methods for casting and, while difficult, is entirely possible to beat the game with only the basic spells. I know, because I did it :)

Here's more recent gameplay of the game's Archmage difficulty
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0G6OqdbPCPs

author: {'steamid': '76561198023322935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 963, 'last_played': 1506718348}
review: I read a comment online by someone who really enjoyed this game and they said that it was like programming with magic. Now that I've finished the game I agree completely. This game was a lot of fun and allowed you to use your imagination in spell creation. You could create simple and easy spells or you could create complex spells. I recommend this game 100%.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032135485', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1505706918}
review: The storyline is pretty straight forward, but the fun is in solving puzzles and manipulating your spells to do fun and interesting things. I'm really enjoying it so far, fun and casual, it keeps it interesting without unnecessary stress.

author: {'steamid': '76561198300602947', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2047, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1671, 'last_played': 1588489860}
review: If you like Zelda Games, you will feel right at home with this game. Fun puzzles to solve thoughtout the whole game, search and find hidden items and magical stones, cool storyline, lots of magical powers to collect to make lots of different spell combinations to assist you on your journey, and game controller works well with gameplay. My only complaint is that the game to me felt a bit too short. But overall the game is awsome and would like to see more games like this. I would recommend this game to friends and all gamers alike!! 5 out of 5!!

gameplay so responsive feels like a very optmiised smooth runing game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005081258', 'num_games_owned': 3910, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 888, 'last_played': 1504300711}
review: Great game, that leaves you wanting more. If you're looking for something like Zelda for PC, this is a good place to start. This game also has one of the very best spell crafting systems I ever seen. Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000785358', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1504212122}
review:
I prefer to write detailed reviews where possible, talking about pro's, con's, what I liked and what I didn't like.

For this game, however, it simply isn't possible. I'm not a console player, and I don't have a controller lying around, and I found that with a mouse and keyboard this game is basically unplayable.

For an action-y game, with precise controls required, the lazy-console-port which resulted in mapping the movement pad straight to WASD (meaning that you only have 8 direction of motion) certainly has a lot of non-8-direction movements required.

It's poorly thought out, poorly implemented and unintuitive. Simply implementing the standard top-down-shooter mechanics of W=towards mouse, S=away from mouse and A/D=strafe would've been a significant improvement. This is not complex or ground-breaking stuff. It's a rookie mistake by a rookie developer and it kills what could've been an awesome game.

[edit]I have uninstalled the game and requested a refund. If the devs ever get around to implementing a decent control scheme, however, I will certainly reconsider this game because it looks great. It's just unplayable.[/edit]

author: {'steamid': '76561198182249311', 'num_games_owned': 206, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1053, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1053, 'last_played': 1504281662}
review: Very nice and interesting. i3-7100U, 8gb ram, hd620 can running this game (in minimum options and some lag) so I'm happy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967453538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 712, 'last_played': 1503842820}
review:
Great game about spell crafting, everything is well balanced and polished : spell-crafing itself, pace, difficulty. 
I hate loosing time walking, fortunatly you could build a craft spell quickly to travel faster.
The game is not very long (10h to achieve main story with 70% overall completion, still some secrets to find) but it matches my current play time so it was just perfect.
I took the game to study the spell-crafting system as a game designer, I enjoyed all the experience and appreciated all the design choices. I wish more game achieve this level of quality !

author: {'steamid': '76561197985662880', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1503860823}
review: Remember those halcyon days of yore when the game's tutorial consisted of, "It's dangerous to go alone, take this!" and you had to figure everything else out?  Mages of Mystralia firmly believes that you are the smart, capable intelligent person your parents claimed you were. While it will still give you tips from time to time, the game revolves around learning by doing. From puzzle solving to boss fights, the game makes you think and challenges you to come up with the perfect spell to solve each one. I have thoughly enjoyed it so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198335032869', 'num_games_owned': 92, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1694145486}

author: {'steamid': '76561197963382257', 'num_games_owned': 114, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 681, 'last_played': 1503796848}
review:
Fall on this game though Steam Discovery queue, and trully amazing experience !

POS :
- Unity can make great games !
- Fun spells
- Story is sweat
- Controls are pretty reactive (played with Keyboard)
- Puzzles are fun and challenging enough even on story mod !
- Boss fights are my favorite, unique and IMAGINATIVE, it really felt like an triple AAA 
- Dialogues, i loved the way characters express themselves indistinguishably, that was cute and funny 
- Environment, hud, enemies : all clean interfaces, there's no useless numbers or writings

Improvements/quality of life :
- Orientation : Signs between zones weren't always clear, a better player lead for quests and travel through zones
- Quest board/panel
- Customized builds  "Wands + Skills switching" maybe a key bind for it M3 to switch between at least 2 builds ore maybe assign a Wand to a spell ?

NEG :
- Nothing really, some people said we have no help or details for spells, but that's the point, for once i don't feel like someone is holding my hand for every move, that's a positive aspect !
At least i didn't feel anything frustating to be reasonably put in this section.


The build i've played was pretty polished for an Indie developper, 2 days later another build with tones of improvements, i was amazed seeying them polish even more !

For a first published game, you can really be proud of your job, you did better than many triple AAA titles.

Can't wait to see another game like this, there's a lot of possibilities where this game go, multiplayer ? With those great boss fights we could be on something !

author: {'steamid': '76561197996715488', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 308, 'playtime_forever': 679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 679, 'last_played': 1503775389}
review:
Mages of Mystralia is an interesting game to review. It's a good game and if they make a sequel I'm sure it will be fantastic, but there are some caveats.

Pros:
Amazing magic system
Gameplay is constantly getting better and better
Good puzzles (Archmage mode)
Spells become incredibly powerful and make you feel amazing

Cons:
Dull start
Balance issues, the start of the game is harder than the end because your magic gets stronger and stronger but enemies don't improve as much
End game magic regen is boring. You'll have a huge mana pool but mana regen never improves.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049239531', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1365, 'last_played': 1500248253}
review:
"Over the past few years, indie games have taken a lot of inspiration from the golden age of gaming â€“ pixel art, higher skill levels, color â€“ but one that doesnâ€™t often get aped is whimsy. That is a pretty abstract concept, but what I mean about whimsy is a certain sense of lightheartedness, or even a sense of innocence. Sure, Nintendo still remains a standard bearer of such a thing, but theyâ€™re pretty much the only ones; and fans donâ€™t always reward that focus. However, we now have Mages of Mystralia, a game thatâ€™s all about whimsy." 

Read the full review at The Young Folks: https://www.theyoungfolks.com/featured/106540/video-game-review-mages-of-mystralia/

author: {'steamid': '76561198059942483', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 522, 'last_played': 1546803487}
review: Absolutely loved Mages of Mystralia, the spellcrafting system is everything I've ever wanted in a game and its a lot of fun to experiment with. Admittedly most of the spells you can possibly make aren't as useful as some but it's still fun to mess around with the runes and see what you can produce.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004630885', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 967, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 936, 'last_played': 1503502592}
review: Great game. The art style is nice, music is good, and the gameplay is enjotable. But, the spelcraft system is where this game shines. It is a joy to tinker through different combinations and reign down destruciton (sometimes literally) or come up with an unconventional solution to a puzzle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037100585', 'num_games_owned': 260, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 549, 'last_played': 1570400616}
review:
Of the time I've spent exploring this game, I have to applaud the concept of spell programming which is a very clever (and useful) mechanic in this game. Plenty of exploration and puzzles which involve the spell programming mechanic, as well as the door puzzles were well planned and cleverly designed.

And just recently, the dev team has introduced the archmage update which gives players old and new an extra challenge, as well as a reason to program those wonderful spells.

The art design and sound direction are wonderful and the storyline is well thought out -- and it all comes together to make a game that is worth your money, and then some. If not for completing the game, then for the ability to design some clever combinations with the spell system.

Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970475840', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 991, 'last_played': 1641262480}
review:
Starting out as a lowly apprentice barely able to cast a fire ball and eventually build up to creating truly complex spells that can then in turn cast other more complex spells was a blast. That and the somewhat rock paper scissors approach to magic and resistance meant that you would be challenged by each new enemy type to create a new spell to counter their element and attack pattern. 

Not that you even need get that focused if you didnâ€™t want to. 
Basic spells work well and I frequently made spells up for fun to just to throw them at enemies to see what worked or was most visually stunning; Like my lightning storm that created frost and tornados that created yet more lightning.

This came in handy as the optional puzzles often ask you to make a spell work in ways you donâ€™t think of during normal fights allowing you to bring that creativity to other parts of the game when they reward you with new spells or modifiers.

Outside of the magic crafting system Mages is a fun Zelda like game. If you enjoy a decent, if somewhat basic, story about magic, creative spell creation as well as the chaos that sometimes brings Iâ€™d recommend Mages of Mystralia.

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197992943573', 'num_games_owned': 753, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1503961680}
review:
Amazing game. Reminds me of old Legend of Zelda games - you've a main quest, and have optional areas that open up when you get new tools.

The spellcrafting system is really fun and well thought out. It also doesn't have to be complicated - a simple fireball with maybe 1 modification will get you through most of the main story, if you want it to - the right staff or robe also helps. As spells grow in complexity, the mana cost also goes up, so there is some balance there. Experimentation is a lot of fun.

There are quite a few puzzles to be solved using the right spells. The harder ones are optional.

The only con I have for this game is that it seems like it's meant for a controller - I had a way easier time when I ditched the keyboard and mouse controls.

Overall, extremely fun. Worth a buy even at full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026506133', 'num_games_owned': 3543, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 733, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 733, 'last_played': 1499913699}
review:
Holy moly was this game a surprising experience!

Ridiculously fun!

Only negatives I felt, was the lack of more content for this deep and varied spell-crafting system! The game could've went up a whole order of magnitude in puzzles and it would've still not reached end of the potential!

Here's hoping to hear more from Borealys!

author: {'steamid': '76561198272887959', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2056, 'last_played': 1521156579}
review:
The idea of crafting your own spell is the biggest gem of this game. I really enjoy doing it myself, as well as looking at others' ideas. The game offers some suggestions in solving the mini-puzzles, but there are a lot of alternatives that you can try. The graphics and music are great. The plot is also nice. 

On the other hand, I think the stages are a bit unbalanced. The earlier stages feel longer, while the later stages (especially Lava Grotto) seem short. 

Overall, I think it is a great game and would recommend it. I believe that there is still a lot of potential in this spell-crafting system, and would like to see more of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049378859', 'num_games_owned': 537, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1089, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1089, 'last_played': 1502052023}
review: cool zelda like game , made in montreal. A bit linear but still fun the spell mechanic is what set this game apart. i wish there was voice for the character instead of the giberish but ,i still like it . the boss are not really hard ,i wish i was a bit tougher .but this game is awesome.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018686466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 166, 'playtime_forever': 1210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1210, 'last_played': 1497139497}
review:
Overall I thought this was an awesome game. The graphics, sound, and user interface were excellent and felt very polished compared to your typical rpg/fantasy/dungeon-crawler game. The best part was probably the spell casting - the way you can build/change spells was very clever and unlike anything I'd played before. 

The only minor complaints that I had: 
a) Not enough variety on enemies
b) Story ended up being a bit weak and lost my attention for the most part
c) Spell casting experimentation isn't really needed to beat the game (except for a few secrets)

author: {'steamid': '76561198139240946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 703, 'last_played': 1501579003}
review:
Worth every penny. Many ways of skill combo. Smart puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022695062', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2911, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2880, 'last_played': 1524610336}
review:
Overall, the game is pretty great. Not phenomenal, but very good.

Pros: 
1. Awesome spell system
2. Interesting story (far more-so if you talk to NPCs regularly)
3. There are fun side-quests/challenges 
4. Fun, yet simple, graphics style
5. Music is reasonably good (never felt the need to turn it off)

Cons:
1. The spell system, being its greatest asset, is sadly not explained in detail very well. You'd never know detonate and overcharge are mutually exclusive, when more complex runes are affecting what they are connected to, or things as simple as how to read the mana requirement bar under the customizable spell name.

2. The game ramps up far too slowly. If I could recommend anything to the developers, it would be to make a couple more augment and/or trigger runes accessible earlier on.

3. Once you learn the system, the game isn't very difficult. The real difficulty is figuring out what I listed as a con under 1. 

Suggestions:
Buy the game. Play the game. Enjoy the game. Then, go spend some time on the forums helping them make it and the sequel even better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050659285', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1495841243}
review:
Mages of Mystralia is a game that presents itself in a very magnificent light at first, but very quickly runs out of steam to keep up that feeling of wonder and meriment as the spell system and what truely unique things you are capable of doing with it stagnate. The game itself also runs out of ideas and restorts to becoming a very simple and plainly boring zelda clone. The only part of the game that truely tests the magic system is the puzzle rooms which encourage you to figure out what spell you can put together to solve the puzzle, meanwhile the latter portion of the game resorts to only 1 of 4 special modifiers actually giving a spell a new function, and that one function will be how you solve essentially the same puzzle over and over.

The only reason I held onto this title for so long was because the story was fairly interesting and I wanted to see how it played off, but the game cuts off like they didn't even finish making the real final boss and just rolled credits. It was clear there was a vision and potential they tried to seek with this game, but in the end it just failed and was a dissapointment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065116263', 'num_games_owned': 282, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 749, 'last_played': 1647720703}
review:
Overall, it's a cute game with a fun play style. 7/10, would recommend.


Pros:

Combat system.

The combat is fun and interesting. The choices in runes allow a certain flexibility in your play style. 

Art.

The art style is adorable.

Cons:

Story.

The story is a bit lacking. The lore isn't very immersive or interesting. About as basic as it gets.

Movement.

Idk if it was just my controller, but the movement was slow and clunky af. It was incredibly annoying in the burning Hamlet scene, with all the traps.


It could definitely use some fixes, but overall, I'd say it's a great experience.



Side note: There is absolutely no fucking reason for the traps to take more than 10 seconds to free me. I lost 3/4s of my health bar just pressing A to get out of those stupid traps. I was defenseless against 2 guards and 2 bats. For the love of christ fix that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058007058', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 655, 'last_played': 1500931579}
review: A Legend of Zelda style game where you create, modify and use your spells to defeat your puzzles and your enemies. A little gem!

author: {'steamid': '76561198104896174', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 389, 'last_played': 1503742386}
review: I love this game. Not only is it beautiful vistually but the soundtrack is amazing too. I backed this as a Kickstarter and I am so glad that I did. I have has nothing but fun playing this game. It's simple to begin with but as time goes on with so many spell combinations it can get really complex. It is full of puzzles for you to complete and it has puzzles that when you first find them you may not have the abilities to complete them so then you have to come back later when you can. This game is wonderful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098017448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1500824543}
review: Fun little game worth the price.  There are lots of puzzles to solves with creative uses of magic.  It actually reminds me of Legend of Zelda games, despite the protaganist being a mage.  As someone who has desperately wanted an action rpg where you play from a spellcaster's perspective, this game scratches that itch.  I have not yet finished the game, and the story so far is rather predictable, but well told.  A game like this proves that you do not need a big budget to make a worthy rpg.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995936916', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1961, 'last_played': 1657867230}
review: This game was very well designed. The gameplay is anywhere from 20-40 hours. The story feels rushed, however the Magic system is amazing, giving you the feeling like you are actually crafting your own custom spells. You can even create nested spells that cast other spells creating massive chain reactions to clear the map. The puzzles are well designed, and there are several ways to complete them. I would defiantly Like to see the story expanded, and additional content added. I applaud the producers for making a great game. This game fells like a mix of Zelda, and Magicka. Overall 9/10 (Just because of the short storyline)

author: {'steamid': '76561198004006208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 177, 'playtime_forever': 1991, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1340, 'last_played': 1500395027}
review:
This game has game breaking bugs due to being released with zero QA testing, how do I know this ? Play through this boring mess and youll soon find it doesnt deliver any freedom promised or quality youd except from a passion project game. A quick search on the steam forums bug reporting page has a ton of posts about game breaking bugs that devs should have fixed long ago. One in particular blocks you from ever accessing the spells menu because if you do you will be locked there due to the escape key breaking whether you are using controller or keyboard. My entire save is now worthless due to piss poor coders that no one would hire for understandably good reason. 

The game itself is so easy that even a 5 year old will get bored of the cliched puzzles and terrible mob AI with predictable boring boss fights. The main characters is a dull ginger kid that looks like Pixars Meridths ugly sister with pretty much zero plot or character development from characters or NPCs. This game utlimatly a classic Kickstarter cash grab in which devs to fucking shit to be hired by quality game companies ebeg there way on to the steam store by wowing us with flashy graphics and gameplay montages that dont really reflect the actually broken mess game we have here.

Do Not Buy This Product 
or anything produced by these fraudsters.
developer_response:
Hi GaiaHero!

Sorry to hear that our game didn't meet your expectations! Although, I just want to clarify a few things here:

First, I see by the screenshot you have posted, the "bug" you encountered is in fact a point of the game where you have to complete the 'trigger rune' tutorial in order to continue the game! On our side, we have to fix the lack of feedback. We already have the solution for that and we will upload it soon with a major update that will include some of our Kickstarter stretch goals!

I also want to mention that we have answered (with short delay) and fixed most of the issues posted on the forum. Some have already been patched and the rest will be part of a major update we are preparing at the moment!

I don't want to change your mind here! I just want to make sure that you understand that that taking care of our community and player base is one of our biggest priorities!

Thanks for your time!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046257814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1015, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1015, 'last_played': 1499577871}
review: Mages of Mystralia is a very charming game. The art style and soundtrack are a nice change of pace and the levels, though simple, are well designed. What really makes the game unique, however, is the spell crafting system. My spellbook felt like my own. Switching and combining spells to suit my needs on the fly was enjoyable. Unfortunately, the story is wildly predictable and a bit lacking.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008964364', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 992, 'last_played': 1602618269}
review:
I bought this game because the premise seemed neat, it looked cute, and the music was enchanting. It was on sale, and I got more than my money's worth.

Where to start? There's a lot of good stuff. I'm not normally a fan of puzzles, but the puzzle mechanics in Mages aren't pushed in your face (Except in the final boss battle, in which it is done BEAUTIFULLY), and they're flexible. Don't have the prerequisite runes for a challenge? If they're behavior runes, maybe you can finagle ones you already have to work for it. Things aren't set in stone, and if you're creative enough, and lucky enough, you can get ahead of the game.

That leads right into runes and spells. Like it says on the tin, you're a Mage. In most games that means you get a few spells that you can customize with a talent or two, making them slightly different. In Mages you have four "behaviours" of spells, each of which determines a lot about the spell - but not nearly everything. Immedi hits things in melee range, right when you use it. Igni creates an orb of its element. Creo creates a full elemental effect. And Ego creates a defensive effect based on its configuration and element.

Runes change how your spells act, and they influence each other as much as your spells. For instance, to start with, Igni creates an immobile, hovering orb of its element (Fire, to start with) that simply sits in place. Not incredibly useful unless you time it right. Combine it with a Homing rune, and you have a mine that seeks out a target when it gets close. Combine those with Move, and you have an enemy-seeking fireball. However, runes have different effects based on the spell they're affecting. For instance, if you combine Ego with a Homing rune, it will pull enemies and objects towards you like a magnet. And then there's combining spells, and...I could go on for a hot minute. Point is, it's fun to see what you can do.

The difficulty scales up pretty quickly, at least for me, which was interesting. It definitely puts pressure on you to stop messing around with funny spells and find ones that work at least reasonably well. Though that isn't to say your "silly" spells aren't useful. Sometimes what you REALLY need is that defunct "bouncing betty" spell you were trying to make work and just left in your spell list.

As well, I've found that there is no one "God spell" or somesuch that will solve EVERY problem. Someone will be immune, or it won't target properly, or it uses too much mana, or something else I can't think of on the spot. Point is, you have to be flexible.

The story is really great. Cute, without being too cheesy or being pointless. I constantly felt as if I had a set goal in mind, even during sidequests. Props.

Probably the only real downside I've found is that the game is SHORT. Not abysmally so, but it's really not long. The story, at least. I've still got a good chunk of game left to explore right now.

It also feels like it might be more intuitive to play it on a controller, but I also feel more comfortable on a keyboard. I don't think it has a real effect on my enjoyment of the game.

I keep thinking that a good way to describe it might be like this: Legend of Zelda, without Link, and Zelda is the hero.

Also: Read the Wanted signs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003518140', 'num_games_owned': 2824, 'num_reviews': 361, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1499043115}

author: {'steamid': '76561197960788171', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1577038881}
review:
Child friendly Adventure RPG. (Probably best played with a controller)

The story of the female protagonist is easy to follow and does not require vast amounts of reading which is ideal for younger gamers and casual gamers a like.  

Graphics are both appealing and soft on the eyes allowing for easy to follow paths and directions so that getting lost is not a problem. 

Spell 'Creation' while being the most complex part of the game is presented in an easy to follow and understand method.

A short if not Ideal game for children and casual gamers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086769861', 'num_games_owned': 989, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1215, 'last_played': 1499310079}
review:
TL;DR: Cute game with a subpar story, some UI issues, but a fun experience at a good length. 7/10

Overall, I liked Mages of Mystralia and thought it was worth the time. I kickstarted it, for your information.

Pros:
- The meat of the game is in the magic creation and the battling. Overall, the battles are pretty good, not great, but by the end of the game you have enough spell capabilities that you can really have some explosive fun. The enemies ramp up in difficulty with a not-too-crazy curve, and it wasn't too hard to keep up, but still felt challenging. The last boss wasn't really "final-boss difficult", but other than that the game's battles presented a good challenge.
- The spellcrafting, while probably not as deep as the creators pretend, is still a lot of fun to build and explore with. I did find that I just relied on four or five powerful spells for most of the game, but it was still fun to create new spells to solve puzzles and earn secrets. 
- The art was cute. Not ground-breaking, but cute and it worked for the style of game. The world building was sufficiently interesting and the characters were entertaining enough.
- The game was the perfect length, in my opinion. I always felt forward momentum, and the difficulty curve matched well.
- I enjoyed the constellations puzzles.

Neutrals:
- The story was engaging enough to keep me a *little* interested but it really could have been significantly more interesting. They seem to set up sequels to this game, but the story wasn't nearly deep enough to warrant any sort of multi-part series.
- The items, wands, and side quests were somewhat lacking, but I never felt a huge need to go get more. The game could have used some healing items (I never found any).

Cons:
- The UI lacked a lot of feedback, especially in the spell crafting. Descriptions of what things were (like when selecting elements) was sorely lacking and made the learning curve steeper than it should have been.
- What the hell is there to use money on? I had 999 currency the entire game, it seemed, never finding anything to spend it on.
- The "homing" attribute of spells didn't work as expected like half the time, which really hurt during battle sometimes.
- The camera angles had some issues.

Overall, solid, cutesy, not-overly-long puzzle and action game. Recommended for fans of the genre looking for some mostly-intuitive spellcrafting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075192649', 'num_games_owned': 596, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1499199761}
review:
As soon as I've seen this game shown in Montreal at the start of the year, I was hooked. The wonderful artistic choices made for this game easily get any player hooked before they even start to play, while the story and gameplay assure player retention. For anyone that has played any Zelda game before and has liked it, this is an amazing game for you. I've only been able to play 4 hours so far because of school, but I can't wait to get back in it and continue acquiring more modifiers for my spells. The only complaint I have about this game would be some of the animations that look a little off, but it is very minor and doesn't ruin the immersion at all.

I give this game my Love rating of 9.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198045474972', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 890, 'last_played': 1497409962}
review:
I love the gameplay, I love love love the spell crafting, and I love the exploration bits. I especially love coming back later and blowing away enemies that caused me so much grief earlier. Buy it for these things.

The story needs another draft or two, especially the start (which made so many leaps in conversational logic that it felt like it needed to be retranslated from whatever the original language presumably was) and the ending (which just... stopped... it felt like it needed a free-roam end section to finish off the game [spoiler]and allow me to chase after the fleeing big bad[/spoiler]). Not to mention the plot twist I could see coming from a mile away, and the character straight up [i]named[/i] "Mentor", like they forgot to give him a proper name and left his character-trope-name in the final draft ([spoiler]and whose inevitable death, btw, is lessened when he plays his dying animation every time you walk into the tower where he dies. It's like he's going "oops, I'm still supposed to be dead" and keeling over to play dead every time you walk by[/spoiler]). The story had some great beats in the middle, [spoiler]like the burning of the town that left the townsfolk questioning their conclusions (and left me unable to complete a sidequest)[/spoiler], but they could have been tied together better.

But the fun spell crafting makes up for it. Once you collect the right runes, you can chain one spell into another into another in an infinite loop that can drain your whole mana bar in one button press if you wish! You can make a spell that fires off four different kinds of elemental magic in one hit, bypassing any resistances the enemy has! You can make it rain fire from the sky! It's amazing! Buy it for that! (And play with a controller.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198297554369', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1245, 'last_played': 1495731056}
review:
This is a fantastic short-term game and I enjoy it. 
Pros:
Great BGM.
Cute and clear art works. 
Simple and easy combat system.
Cons:
Storyline is too short and I want to play more!
Some spells are too strong that you may use them from the beginning to the end so that you can not well experience the dynamic spell-crafting system.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163402716', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 807, 'last_played': 1498945252}
review: This is a great game that appeals to my imagination with a variety of spell combinations to discover. I don't often feel the need to complete games 100% but this is definitley one I am aim to ace. I've put about 12 hours into this title and I can absolutely see myself putting in many more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107492935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1212, 'last_played': 1572663289}
review:
So overall I loved this game a lot. It was amazing to play. The only real problem I had is the story felt rushed, especially the last half. But it made up for it with a wonderful spell crafting system that allowed me to make some simply overpowered room-killing spells that would activate and run automatically. The magic system in this game is what I've been looking for in every game involving magic I've ever played. Consequently, this is the only game to ever get what I wanted pretty much right (I do kind of wish that multiples of the same rune could be applied to each spell, but that's pretty much my only complaint about the magic system).

8/10 (would be 7/10 for the lackluster rushed story, but the magic system demands an entire point back and I shall oblige it)

author: {'steamid': '76561198116173366', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 914, 'last_played': 1612617048}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970730744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 878, 'last_played': 1499656914}
review:
Super fun  indie title.

Plays like a top-down Zelda with spell crafting.  The spell components seem silly at first as they are each quite granular.  However, once you've unlocked a bunch you can make crazy and interesting effects.

The story presents a fascinating world, and the art is vibrant.  Pretty music too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035288777', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1498510437}
review:
Overall the game felt like it was a demo of a game. The story was lacking and this is my largest complaint. It creates more questions than it answers and it doesn't provide many answers. Ontop of that the few answers you do get you guessed from the start. You could guess how most of the game was going to go by the time the intro ended.

The gameplay was great, but I feel the spell combinations didn't always feel meaningful. It didn't offer a lot of gameplay time and overall felt like I just played a game that was half finished when they ran out of will to finish it.

The game had promise, but I feel like they really missed the bar.

review: God yes, this game is great. Buy it if you can, seriously. Wonderful story, decent pacing, good gameplay, puzzles that make you think. It's better on a controller but it's a infintesmially small improvement imo, so you can play just fine on a PC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010611322', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 791, 'last_played': 1498131486}
review:
Edit: I've reached 92% completion now so I feel fairly confident in expanding on a few things I was on the fence about earlier.

Mages of Mystralia is budget Zelda with a splash of Magicka. Unfortunately some incredibly uncreative writing, limited scope and a lack of polish in key areas will probably stop MoM ever getting recognition it deserves.

Mouse and keyboard are good despite the suggestion to use a controller, at no point did I feel the need to switch.

Combat is the biggest thing holding MoM back. In a better game studious use of dash and shield, mana management and the right spell use would be key to overcoming the game's most difficult challenges. The reality is once you settle on a specific combination you'll probably continue to use that with only minor tweaks as you unlock more modifiers.There are a couple of enemies that will give you pause the first time you encounter them but they both have very exploitable weaknesses.

Combat strategy isn't much deeper than 'unload your most powerful spell and run around so you don't get stunlocked to death.' Mana regen is slow, and even approaching the end game a full pool isn't enough to take out more than 2 or 3 weaker enemies at once. The toughest enemy in the game can take close to a minute to take down, however due it's slow movement speed and low damage it's a not threat compared to several weaker enemies which will ensure that once you're knocked down you're not getting back up.

Spellcrafting and the process of collecting more modifiers for your spells is the game's best aspect, however many of the modifiers are either useless or mandatory and some completely invalidate others. If you're wondering how many spells you actually have it's basically area blast, area explosion, projectile, area damage over time, dash, shield, clone. Some of which can be set to trigger into others. They vary for each element (fire, lightning, ice, earth) but very rarely in a way that will mean you'll have to reconsider how you'll use it.

Puzzle elements are consistently rewarding but mostly pretty simple, fortunately the game respects the player's intelligence enough to not feed them the answer before they've even begun.

Environmental design is consistently good if a little bland, level design is almost flawless.

Story has a couple of mildly interesting points stuck in the sort of plot a computer could spit out (the goblins grow bolder, quaint village is razed, go collect the things and fight the guy, roll credits). The game has no shortage of characters, none of which are memorable. Even your mad, talking spellbook who will occasionally comment on environmental objects just fades into the whitenoise of the rest of the game. There's even an optional 'scene' in which you revisit the house of your mentor, you can read his diary and find out why he trained you, poignant music plays in the background. No one's gives a fuck about this guy, he must have less than 50 lines of dialogue in the entire game and he does nothing interesting or memorable whatsoever.

10/10 it's okay

author: {'steamid': '76561197978126730', 'num_games_owned': 1126, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 637, 'last_played': 1497413075}
review:
Mages of Mystralia is a game that will enchant more than magic spells with its accessible spellcrafting mechanics, sublime soundtrack, and Zelda-like linear progression.

You can read the full review at [url=http://www.geeksundergrace.com/gaming/review-mages-of-mystralia-pc/]Geeks Under Grace.[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198052492115', 'num_games_owned': 73, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 661, 'last_played': 1497403875}
review:
It's a good game. 
I came for an experience like Lichdom battlemage i wanted an expansive spell crafting system. This game 5/10 delivers that the spellcrafting system is "Okay".

The game shines in it's art style and overall fun, like zelda if link was a mage.

Good game, i liked it. Wish the spellcraft was more lichdom like.

Il n'y a rien de pire que de se retrouver Ã  sec en plein combat contre un boss! Sachez toutefois que l'on peut consommer des ressources spÃ©ciales nous remontant automatiquement notre mana et notre vie, pratique mais rare. Il y a Ã©galement une gestion d'inventaire et d'Ã©quipement dans Mages of Mystralia. Il faudra changer de baguettes magiques en fonction de leurs bonus et des situations que l'on va devoir gÃ©rer. La glace fonctionnera mieux contre des ennemis de feu par exemple.

Mignon mais pas si facile que ca!

Mages of Mystralia est un jeu trÃ¨s complet, il dispose d'une excellente durÃ©e et de vie et bien des challenges Ã  affronter. Comptez 12-14 heures pour en venir Ã  bout et 6-8 heures en plus pour peu que vous souhaitiez dÃ©bloquer tout ce que propose le jeu en matiÃ¨re de runes, puzzles et de challenges divers. En plus des puzzles utilisant les sorts afin de dÃ©bloquer des runes, il existe aussi d'autres types de puzzles nÃ©cessitant une forte rÃ©flexion afin de placer des curseurs dans le bon endroit afin d'illuminer toutes les piÃ¨ces dudit puzzle. C'est parfois complexes mais tellement gratifiant lorsque l'on y arrive par soi-mÃªme. Le style graphique du jeu est juste impeccable avec des effets de sorts splendides et un character design original et rÃ©ussi. La maniabilitÃ© est excellente avec des touches bien pensÃ©es et une gestion parfaite des manettes Xbox One et 360. Le jeu est intÃ©gralement en excellent franÃ§ais ce qui est un Ã©norme plus!

Je me suis rÃ©galÃ© en jouant Ã  Mages of Mystralia que ce soit au dÃ©but ou Ã  la fin malgrÃ© un challenge final plutÃ´t corsÃ©. Ne vous fiez pas aux graphismes mignons et au cÃ´tÃ© cartoon, ce jeu est difficile et ne conviendra pas aux plus jeunes d'entre vous. Mention spÃ©ciale Ã  la bande son qui est vraiment excellent et apporte un Ã©norme plus Ã  l'ambiance et Ã  la qualitÃ© du jeu. Il s'agit d'une excellente surprise me concernant mÃªme si j'ai participÃ© Ã  la campagne Kickstarter et que j'ai pu y jouer en version beta. Le dÃ©veloppeur canadien est trÃ¨s ouvert et extrÃªmement rapide en matiÃ¨re de patch et d'Ã©quilibrage des sorts. Si vous aimez les bons jeux d'action avec une bonne dose de rÃ©flexion, Mages of Mystralia est un des meilleurs jeux du genre sortis cette annÃ©e.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014863727', 'num_games_owned': 424, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 452, 'last_played': 1497600255}
review:
As a Kickstarter backer, I started out hoping to love this game. Mostly, I do. Certainly the amount of sleep I lost from not being able to stop the first night I played is a positive sign.

That said, it has some rough edges that need work. Most importantly, the keyboard/mouse controls are a bit clunky and not configurable. I was worried when I saw the "plays best with a controller" warning during startup; luckily I've only hit one thing that baffled me for a while (namely, your character's facing is irrelevant even when using a directional shield spell - it's the relative direction to the mouse pointer. Very unintuitive, though once I caught on it was actually easier to use.)

But it's extremely frustrating to not be able to configure the k/m controls. I am stuck with keyboard equivalents for spells 3 and 4 when I have three perfectly useful extra mouse buttons; it's particularly clumsy to target a spell with mouse and spacebar while also in motion (WASD).

Given the chance to do more than thumbs up or down, I'd give this game a solid A for design and features (not an A+ because of the puzzles that require split-second timing instead of solid thinking) but only a B or B- for playability on mouse and keyboard.

author: {'steamid': '76561198291895958', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1497141810}
review:
This game first caught my attention at PAX East back in March. It was the last day of the convention and I only had two appointments, so I mostly spent the day walking around checking out booths, and Iâ€™m so glad I got to try this one out! Mages of Mystralia follows the journey of a young mage-in-training named Zia, who struggles to protect the valley she calls home while fighting the anti-magic ruling class of Mystralia.

So Iâ€™m gonna dig right into it with Mystraliaâ€™s spell crafting system, which is this gameâ€™s main and strongest feature. Mystralia focuses quite a bit on puzzle solving to move through its many dungeons, and this is accomplished through the use of four basic spells: Immedi, which allows for melee attacks and bursts, Actus, which creates mines and projectiles, Creo, which can create a variety of useful tools from ice bridges to windy tornados, and Ego, which is used to cast shields, dash, and more. As you move through the game, you find runes which allow you to modify the spells in certain ways. Behavior runes allow you to modify a spellâ€™s behaviors, such as making it move, multiplying the effect, or making the effects more potent. Augment runes effect behavior runes and base spells in certain ways, making them veer left or right, extending their time, or causing a spell to move backwards.. Trigger runes allow spells to trigger other spells, creating cascading chains. All these alterations, however, are dependent on your level of mana. The more alterations you make, the more mana a spell costs. Adding complex trigger spells could result in you only getting off one spell and then being left in the lurch! Later, you can also change the essence (element) of the spell to create different effects. The nice thing about the spell system is that you can save and rename spells. This allows you to quick cycle through your spells for battles and fast puzzles.

And like I said, most of this game is environmental puzzle solving. In addition to the dungeons, which are filled with Zelda-esque puzzle solving, there are puzzles are hidden around the valley. Solving these puzzles with grant you purple soul beads, which you can use to purchase health and mana upgrades at the mageâ€™s Haven. These puzzles my also yield runes. As far as I could tell, important runes were hidden in obvious places in the dungeons while runes not necessarily required to complete missions were scattered around the world. While these ruins may be skipped over or collected later, collecting the runes earlier allows for more diverse gameplay and styles. I am a huge fan of puzzle solving in RPG adventures, and love hidden collectibles, so this was a treat to see. In general, this game rewards those who explore hub areas, talk to NPCs, and complete side quests. My favorite!

The story, from what Iâ€™ve seen so far, is fast-paced, which keeps the game moving at a good speed, but there are actually times I wish the game would slow down and tell the story a bit more fully. We are rapidly introduced to the world of mages then almost immediately sent on a series of quests to save the valley. We meet necromancers and sages and (no spoilers) but a character that seems important dies suddenly off screen. Environmental storytelling helps to cushion the pacing, but this world is ancient and magical and Iâ€™d love to take a little more time to appreciate it. Speaking of the world, the styling of the game is beautiful. The colorful and simple but detailed design is reminiscent of The Windwaker series or Epistory. When occasionally playing cutscenes things can look a little clunky, but just in overall game play the world looks great, and plays great. Even with more complex spells, I didnâ€™t notice any particular issues with frame rates or graphics. 

The camera is fixed, moving along its own set path. By and large, this is fine, because even when moving behind buildings you can see Zia silhouetted on the other side, however for some challenges and puzzles I wish it were possible to get a little more perspective on the situation. Additionally, I will say that there are certain cases, when facing mobs of monsters, you can drain your mana very quickly and be forced to dodge attacks while your mana reloads. There are a few situations where this leaves you backed in a corner absorbing a lot of damage. I never died in one of these attacks and there is a quick mana recharge option that can be used as long as you have a spare mana charm, but I can see that being a potentially frustrating situation for some gamers.

So letâ€™s bring it home with my final thoughts on Mages of Mystralia. This is a gamers to program their own way through puzzles and battles under the guise of magic. The story can be too fast-paced and you may occasionally have to deal with camera issues while searching for secrets or fighting a particularly nasty mob, but I think this game set out to do one thing really well and I think it nailed it. I recommend this game for any adventure RPG fan.

review:
Hallo Zusammen,

Mages of Mystralia ist ein sehr gut gelunges Spiel, wo meine seine eigenen FÃ¤higkeiten verbessern kann wie auch die ZaubersprÃ¼che. Die MÃ¶glichkeit die ZaubersprÃ¼che mit Unterschliedchen FÃ¤higkeiten oder Aktionen auszustatten gibt einem eine fast unendliche auswahl an Kominationen.

Der Grafikstil, Musik und auch die Geschichte passen sehr gut zusammen.
Wie am Anfang des Spieles hingewiesen wird, gibt es bei den Deutschen Texten hier und da noch Fehler, aber daran arbeiten die Entwickler ja.

Meine Empfehlung hat es aufjedenfall.

Solltet Ihr Fragen haben, werde ich euch diese gerne beantworten, falls die Review nicht ausreichen sollte. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198043392766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1354, 'last_played': 1497230362}
review:
Magicka mixed with Link to the Past!

The very easy to use spell crafting system has a surprising amount of depth. It's similar to Magicka in that there are some base spell types that are cast with different buttons. Instead of creating "combos" like in Magicka, you build the spells using modifiers that you unlock as you progress through the game. For example: start with creating a flame that hovers in place; attach the  'move' modifier to create a fireball type spell, then link detonate to it to create an exploding fireball. After 10 hours in I've created about 8-10 completely different spells. 

PROS: fun spell creation, great sense of progression, pretty good puzzles
CONS: the writing isn't that great

author: {'steamid': '76561198092412233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1214, 'last_played': 1495929723}
review:
Pros:
â€¢ Entertaining combat
â€¢ Creative puzzles with multiple solutions
â€¢ Crafting spells was pretty entertaining

Cons:
â€¢ Fewer combinations than you would think - there are a lot of things that just don't work together for some reason.
â€¢ The story takes a backseat to the gameplay, to the point where it's easy to forget it's there half the time
â€¢ No quest tracker, so it's very easy to lose track of what quests you're doing
â€¢ No real map/minimap, forcing you to memorize layouts or run around in circles for a long time trying to find things
â€¢ [spoiler]100% completion doesn't change or add to the disappointing ending[/spoiler]

Overall, the pros outweigh the cons, but in the next game, I really want to see more combat-based spells, better story writing, and QoL improvements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030774954', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1025, 'last_played': 1573927454}
review:
One of the best new games I've played in a while. Definate thumbs up. Things to note: As of this writing you really should have a controller to play it right. They are working on better keyboard bindings and I am sure that in the future this will not be such an issue.

While it might look like a simple platformer at first the spell grid sigil system is pretty neat, and there are fun puzzles, both to open areas in a grid like puzzle format and in figuring out how to best build spells to solve other puzzles.

That combined with the over all story (which is a bit campy and tongue in cheek but cute) leads to a fun game.

If I were to make any suggestions about the game I would say that each time you get a sigil it would be nice to see a little example, like a cut scene or one free example of a spell using it so that the player knows what it does more clearly. The tool tips are nice but sometimes it is not entirely clear what a function does and how best to place it in a grid to get the desired effect.

Still, it is a great game and I encourage you to try it, at $25 (at the time of this writing) I found it actually a pretty good deal.

The one other thing I'd like to see is a variant of this where you can play a necromancer with different spells and so on. I think that'd be pretty neat, or a DLC using the same world but a different approach. Really could expand the game if they are looking for a good way to add dlc or the like!

author: {'steamid': '76561197980935471', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 735, 'last_played': 1496101901}
review:
This game is just super good. Very polished, great sound track, excellent art style, very fun. 

Ever wanted to play the Legend of Zelda as Zelda? And Zelda is a kick ass mage? This is that game!

It's the right length too, I'm so sick of hundred hour plus open world games with no coherent story.. I completed the main quest in about 12 hours, and could probaby 100% it in about 15, but that is just perfect in my opinion. It never wore out it's welcome and I'll be looking forward to any sequels or expansions.

The lore is surprisingly deep as well, and the story, while not particularly surprising in how it plays out, it solid and engaging. Doesn't feel like a D&D clone or a rip off of any other lore.

All around, I can't recommend it enough!

author: {'steamid': '76561197999053174', 'num_games_owned': 515, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 3378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3378, 'last_played': 1530567596}
review:
HIGHLY recommended

First off, the game overall feels a lot like a Legend of Zelda game. Everything from the breakable pots strewn everywhere, to the NPC interactions, to the storyline, to the bosses, to the zones that feel a lot like LoZ dungeons, to your helpful companion (who isn't annoying, by the way), to the fact that you can revisit places armed with new abilities to access previously inaccessible areas. Main differences are that Zia actually talks, and is a mage instead of a sword and shield warrior.

Which brings me to the spellcrafting. It's pretty awesome. Every time I find a new spell compoment, I'm filled with excitement with all the new things it lets me do. I spend a lot of time just making different spells and trying them out.

Also the soundtrack is excellent. And has a neat touch: For each overworld zone, there are three variations of the music. When you start fighting it seamlessly blends into battle music, and when you pause or open your inventory or spellbook, it softens to a more ambient version. The soft versions are very pretty.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088273249', 'num_games_owned': 493, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 863, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 863, 'last_played': 1496075066}
review:
Kickstarted the game the second i saw it on the site, today, after unlocking everything and doing all the achievements it's time for a short review :

Positive :
- Graphics, I really liked them, cartoonish enough for my taste
- Spells, the main appeal of the game, this is where the game shines the most with amazing capabilities, you can really make some crazy cools spells which can absolutly destroy the game ( litteraly )
- Gameplay is perfectly tuned, as a keyboard/mouse player I had zero problem doing what I want in the game

Neutral :
- Soundtrack, since I almost always play game with my own music I don't know if the soundtrack of the game is good :x

Negative : 
- The story is simple and you can see everything that's going to happen before it happens. It does the trick but I expected  more when one of the selling point of the game was the script being written by a famous D&D ( if i'm not wrong ) gamemaster and writter.
- The difficulty, this game is easy, way too easy, except for the achievement where you have to die against a boss to get revived by a scarabee I never died ( very zelda style with fairy which is good in Zelda since boss fight or the game in general isn't that easy, I MEAN REALLY EASY ).
- The game is short, VERY SHORT, it took me less than 12h to 100% with all achievements which could be even less if I wasn't a dumbass who did too much backtracking, this is for me the main problem for a game sold 23â‚¬ (or whatever in $) 
it is way too short and has absolutly no replay value ( if i wasn't a backer who paid it 17$, which i'm still a little mad about I would be really p*ssed )

In conclusion Mages of Mystralia is a good game but who suffers from a lack of difficulty and life expectancy, if it was a 15â‚¬ game it would be acceptable but not at this price which is only justified by the " big names " attached to it, that's sad since it will probably repulse a lot of potential players, so my advice wait for it with at least 40% reduction before it's worth it.
P.S : The developers are still adding things in the game with a Archimage (Hard) mode and a Speedrunner, which I really hope will be able to compensate for the game defaults, still I liked it !

review:
This is a fun little game!
Spellbuilding by combining various runes makes for a nice variety in the spells you can craft, and they can get pretty crazy once you've gotten a lot of the unlocks.
Graphics are colorful and pretty and fit the game well.
Music is lovely as well.
My only complaint would be the amount of content for the price point. I 100%ed the game in 12 hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000298969', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 890, 'last_played': 1495921716}
review:
TLDR: Very addictive gameplay and a good experience. Maybe a bit too easy (for me anyway) and no adjustable difficulty. Hoping for an expansion. 8/10.
-----
Like other people are saying, the spell creation is awesome. It's simple to understand with lots of combinations and different modifiers.

I really enjoyed the game, and it's a nice thing that all the challenges/quests are solveable the whole game through. No risk of missing anything.

Graphics are really saturated and cute, kind of cartoonish that works really well. Background audio is fitting for the environments. Sound effects are good and delivers the right atmosphere.
The UI is clean and the menu system is simple and easy. No issues at all.

Personally I had no bugs or error except for one tiny thing - when I got struck by an enemy the camera stopped following me for a short time. But when I ran out of picture and back again it snapped right back to me. No biggie and it only happened once.

The game offers some interesting challenges, but I wish there was an option for a harder difficulty setting. I completed the game without ever dying. Which doesn't have to be a bad thing, of course.
To me the hardest part of the game was _finding_ all the extra stuff. A lot of running around and checking every corner.

The game recommends playing with a controller when you start it, and I totally agree. This game could probably be played with KB/M, but with the controller everything just feels right. I think it would be pretty hard keeping all the spells intuitive on the keyboard. 

If you're looking for a cozy adventure game with magic and puzzles, you have it right here. â‚¬20 is a good pricing and I feel it was worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963569209', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1499473602}
review: Very cute game with a deceptively complex spell creation system and fun puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042833856', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 850, 'last_played': 1641867956}
