author: {'steamid': '76561198014567042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 873, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 725, 'last_played': 1499144199}
review:
I enjoy this game a lot. There's a good set of puzzles, but not so hard that they're frustrating.

The "programming" aspect of the magic is also pretty amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992284390', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 652, 'last_played': 1710770935}
review: One of the best single-player games I've played in over 10 years. Phenomenal spellcrafting system with surprisingly solid "balance" throughout a majority of the game. Engaging and tricky puzzles. An amazing game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037942217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 578, 'last_played': 1644194077}
review:
I really want to like this game. The idea is very good. But the controls (at least on the PC) are just horrible. The fact that you can't change the key bindings is just one thing. That in itself wouldn't be too much of a tragedy.
But later when you have to switch quickly between spells, it just becomes really awkward because you have to cycle through them and keep pressin a number key just exactly as many times an fast enough before the little un-intuitive "quick menu" disappears.

But the worst thing is the actual controlling of the character. Sometimes she just seem to go in random directions. I just got stuck to a wall and no matter which keys I press she just kept running into the wall.
This is a HUGE downside, because a lot of the puzzles are time-based platforming. So you have to quickly and precisely get from one point to an other. Nigh impossibel and very frustrating.

Right now I can't recommend this game. Maybe they will fix these in a patch later.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972205659', 'num_games_owned': 844, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1496115425}
review:
It takes a bit to really get started, but the magic system in this Zelda-like adventure game is a puzzle in itself. Once you have a few runes to experiment with it's really satisfying to find spell combos to solve specific challenges. Having to make the runes all fit with certain criteria keeps it a puzzle without feeling like you're too restricted.

You can have multiple custom spells memorized for each slot, so having a full utility belt is easy to do. The only complaint I have so far is the spell hotkey system's controls. You have 1-4 on the keyboard set for spell slots, and tap the keys repeatedly to cycle each slot's spell. The issue is the first press doesn't change the selected spell out. This wouldn't be a problem if it was selecting a slot on the first press ro something, but each slot is already bound to different cast keypresses (left/right click, space, shift-click) so there's no need to select. And if you dont press the same key again fast enough the spell selection times out. This is a real pain in something like the boss battles where you can suddenly be swarmed by smaller enemies and want to shit to a more efficient spell.

Other then that, this is a great game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994086287', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1511726187}

author: {'steamid': '76561198095826198', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 943, 'last_played': 1562024364}
review:
Just finished playing it through one time and  absolutely love the gaming features such as builing your own spells and using them to solve puzzles. The characters were amazing as well, couldn't help falling in love with them, especially Zia.
 The one thing that I'm wondering about is if any more story content will be added at a latter date. I just felt that too many loose ends were left alone, especially at the end. Hopefully something well come along.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023866840', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 852, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 851, 'last_played': 1496610108}
review:
A lovely game with fantastic gameplay, really fun just to fool around with the spells you can create. Nice story though it peeters off towards the start of the 3rd act. Very well made though I noticed someframe chugging for me personally in some of the larger areas (on a 980).

Great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198253070499', 'num_games_owned': 293, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1495872056}
review: This game deserves the good reviews it has gotten. It has some weird animation bugs, but the game play and rune machanics are very fun and there is a chess themed boss fight that i loved, I thaught it was amazingly creative. Definitly play it  if you like fighting monsters as a wizard and solving puzzles in dungeons.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129748645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1162, 'last_played': 1495742027}

author: {'steamid': '76561198035858629', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1446, 'last_played': 1504209617}
review:
Gioco stupendo, consigliatissimo specialmente se vi sono piaciuti titoli come Torchlight e Zelda.
L'unica pecca Ã© la peronalizzazione del prsonaggio, che Ã© completamente assente, ma compensata egregiamente con la possibilitÃ  di modificare gli incantesimi.
Molto interessanti anche gli enigmi da risolvere, modificando gli incantesimi per farli rimbalzare, viaggiare all'indietro, esplodere all'impatto cambiando elemento.
La storia dura circa 8-10 ore.
Traduzione in italiano molto accurata con pochissimi errori.
Spero che continueranno a svilupparlo, aggiungendo nuovi capitoli e/o DLC, o facendo un sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168126262', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 588, 'last_played': 1496743172}

author: {'steamid': '76561198106381324', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1496096727}
review:
This game deserves more attention. This is essentially a Legend of Zelda game with magic replacing the typical tools.

If you are familiar with Tyranny's spell crafting system, this is essentially that but in an action setting. Spells can be modified to multiply, alter direction, bounce of walls, cast other spells and so much more. You will spend a lot of time tinkering with the spell system to come up with some crazy spells. 

It also makes the optional content more enticing since you could get more ways to alter your spells. The game also makes use of interesting puzzles that will involve modifying your spells to achieve the objective. Thankfully, the game will indicate if you have the right runes in each puzzle so you dont need to tear your hair out trying to find a solution you dont have yet.

Controls are tight. You will be swapping through spells in the heat of combat with no problem, which is a good thing since the game keeps introducing new factors to prevent you from spamming the same couple of spells. Overall, this is a great game and I hope it gets more attention.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036443476', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 618, 'last_played': 1495704083}
review:
The spell crafting is the main event here. I didn't really like the visual style, it was pretty clean and the color palette was very appropriate for each area, but the models and animation really didn't work for me. This game rewards completionist and explorers while having a good pace about each area. 95% of the time the spells were intuitive, but the occasional hiccup wasn't a big problem. The music was solid enough that I wouldn't listen to other music on the side while playing, which is an accomplishment when it comes to soundtracks and sound design. 

[b]TL;DR[/b]: I liked being able to express my creativity in spells and I love collecting things that are useful, which this game has plenty of. Despite the game's weaknesses those two features carried the whole enjoyment of the game for me and I had a great time. 

--- Somewhat spoilery from here on ---

A problem I can't entirely blame on the developers is the dominant strategy gameplay and low difficulty. Considering how much freedom we have in spellcrafting it would be hard to balance the game if certain players never found or experimented with the right spells to be strong enough to fight the bosses. I think they were undertuned for this reason, but its a bit too low. They made a good move with the 4 spell types so it avoids some of the "make the best spell then never change it" style gameplay, but doesn't really fix it.

The last section of the story is the weakest when it comes to pacing. You've finally acquired all the main elements for spellcrafting, then you go through a simple gauntlet to the boss and its over. The element of your birthright as Zia is the last and most unused element just because it's last. 

The balance of puzzle to combat is just about perfect. Each has some problems though:
The puzzles that aren't "drag circles with arrows" puzzles, the kind that are in the world are the best ones. They're only interesting early on when you have limited spells and need to use some creativity. My favorite was using the Shield spell with the homing modifier to pull items towards you. Pulling an explosive barrel into a destroyable wall was the most "I think I figured this out earlier than I needed to" moment I had, which was great experience. Most of the rest are simple or a little too precise to not have brute force be easiest solution. 
Combat almost works, but I feel like kiting gameplay gets old after a while. Being chased by multiple enemies seems to class with spell casting. There are four reinforced combat dynamics:
1-Shoot your best spell before it can touch you.
2-Run, turn around, shoot fast spell, turn again and run untill you have distance.
3-Run, cast an area of effect spell, keep runing.
4-Attach a reversed strong spell to the dash and just dash in straight lines. 
(5-Change element of any of the above if they're resistant)
[olist]
[*]usually fails and leads to 2, 
[*]is 90% of the game, 
[*]is boring and weak, 
[*]s very effective but too repetetive to not be boring.
[/olist]
2 has an alternate where you drop stone copies of yourself to draw aggro and shoot whoever is tricked, but it really is just the same. Run, shoot, run, shoot. Its engaging because it will kill you if you don't keep running and shooting, but its not that deep. 

There is little precision and little thinking when it comes to most enemies. The interesting ones are the shaman ones who capture and reflect spells and the scorpions that have an armored carapace that can be broken with explosives. They get subverted when you get enough magic to spam spells, but untill then they're pretty interesting. I may be forgetting one or two other interesting ones but most are just [charge straight at the player unless staggered]. 

This game could use some more puzzle bosses. The chess crypt boss was really close to being very solid, the floor mechanic just missed the mark a little. The big tree was just ok, it needed to be simple since it was an early boss. The twin slimes was just ok too, but gets points in making you decide who to attack in the boss itself. The ice salamander was mostly a waiting game. 

I'm not much of a story structure-literate person, so I won't comment on it, someone else probably will say what I could much better. I liked the voice blurbs, but I'd like if there could be more of them so it didn't sound like it repeated so often. 

[i]To summarize and mention some other things:[/i][list]
[*]Great magic system with questionable balance
[*]solid music
[*]one good boss and two good enemies
[*]magic casting clashes with the enemies in the game
[*]meaniful collectables that approach a metroidvania
[*]classic but overused elemental areas like ice, fire, and forest, the crypt and mine were a nice change of pace and had good puzzles
[*]I liked Zia as a character, but the overall character art style wasn't my cup of tea. Maybe it's a cultural difference, or maybe I'm too used to [i]muh japanese anime style[/i]
[/list]
I don't think I'd replay the game, but my playthrough was a great time and it was very worth the price and time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014816693', 'num_games_owned': 1002, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1309, 'last_played': 1495688026}
review:
Received via Kickstarter  (Mage King reward level)

I wanted to hold off on a review until I had finished the game, which I did this morning, quickly followed by finishing up the few achievements I had left. After finishing the game I can say that I don't regret in the slightest backing the project and have been recommending the game to all of my friends. 

The game itself was written by Ed Greenwood, of Forgotten Realms fame. It has a very bright and colorful visual aspect. While it does have combat and a few mentions of darker content (very glossed over), it's suitable for schoolage children and older gamers alike. 

The game story isn't super deep and I really hope they expand on it with future DLC, but where Mages really excels at are its spellcrafting system and its puzzles. Every spell in the game is something you have to craft yourself, from a simple lightning slash to screen-filling homing fireballs that explode with ice. The puzzles come in two types. Some you have to craft a spell with just the right properties to fulfill the requirements, and others you have to move connectors to form a specific pattern. The lasty thing I'll mention here is that the soundtrack is EXCEPTIONALLY well done, and really adds to the game experience.

There are some downsides. Quests are very basic, mostly in the errand/fetch category, and there aren't very many of them at all. Some of them seem very very basic at that, with some NPCs seemingly losing interest in what they asked for. In fact, some of the NPCs are very basic, something that occurs in most games to be honest but with the low NPC count in this game its much more noticable. My only other complaint is that if you boil away all of the exploration and rune/bead hunting, the game is actually quite short. I have roughly 22 hours in the game, but 3/4 of that is all treasure hunting.


Pros:
Amazing spellcrafting system
Vibrant, cheerful colors
Overall story is great
Awesome puzzles
Spellcrafting deserves two mentions
Amazing soundtrack

Cons:
Quests are basic and simple
Not enough quests
NPCs aren't fleshed out
Main story is a bit short

author: {'steamid': '76561198063300679', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 497, 'last_played': 1691813786}
review:
Not played a lot, but i see a lot of potential in this game. The only real issue i have with this game is the slightly clunky combat, though the runes have potential to make that smoothe out. 
Pros would be the sound track, the charm, the art style, and most of all the puzzles. Some of the puzzles are difficult enough to be interesting, but all are satisfying in one way or another. 
Concept reminds me of magic maker, though made by an actual studio and not looking like a flash game.

review:
It's pretty, and the spellcrafting is really well done, but the actual game is pretty ametuer.
It's not even really bad its just mediocre.
It has lots of little problems and is overall quite boring except when you're crafting new spells.
Unless you're REALLY into spellcrafting as a concept or really like the art, I do not recomend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127202621', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 435, 'last_played': 1495419824}
review:
I tried to see negative reviews on this.  It says there are 6 but try to see them and it shows none.  I am adding mine as a negative.  BECAUSE I DID NOT ENJOY IT AS MUCH AS I WANTED TO.  I also want to see if it shows up.  I recommeng the purchase for people who have tastes between casual and light experience as a game.  More experienced gamers play everything.  :)

I loved the art, but did not like the character.  I had no issue with her, but I have no affinity for Zia.  I have no issue playing  female.  I just don't care for her.  I have no reason to care about anyone in this story.  The city had one good thing, a reference to Terry Pratchett.  *Salute*

Other than that everything in the world felt telegraphed.  It was too easy - and it had to be because of how linear it is.

The game mechanic is a great step - but incomplete.  I would love to see this grown into a real experience, but for now, there is little more to this than an easy beat-em-up....  with the same areas over and over with more difficult, but not really hard, enemies that scale to your new spells.  Frankly, at that point - this is a one time playthrough that has no pay-off.  Mods will save this, but what is here feels like a game that needs mods, which seems like it is flexible, but actually has less freedom and is somehow more linear than Torchlight.  I keep looking to hope this is just early access.

The spell crafting is neat, but needs more sophistication and maybe some actual context.  It is not *endless* by any means.  No object animation, no combining elements to fuse hybrids...  Also, Regio would be a better name for Actus, and Muto would be a better one for Ego.  Also, what Mage doesn't have conjuration???  The magick is light programming logic with limited effective combinations - to solve puzzles.   The rest is beat em up with magic....  with infinite respawning enemies in areas that are small in size and hedged in.

As for spell crafting - Two Words 2 is ABSOLUTELY MORE FLEXIBLE.

The story is dialed in.  I love Ed Greenwood.  I really enjoyed the world of Faerun for decades.  It does not even fit the atmosphere.  It certainly does not hit like Spellfire, but it has glimmers of it...  The music is lovely, but doesn't shine.  Good background.  As a game, this would likely be a much more fun experience for an inexperienced or casual gamer.

The art is superb and I wanted to enjoy this more than I did.  I might finish it in my spare time, but until then it is in my play of played too much to refund but don't care how it ends.  Also, i want it to do well enough someone uses what is in this game to make a game I DO enjoy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035338114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 590, 'last_played': 1497161228}
review:
This is an incredible game solely based on its spellcrafting system. 

Sure, the writing and pacing might feel a bit drab; the UI isn't the smoothest thing to use; we're sorely missing a minimap/radar function; sometimes the spells don't fly the way you point and you might encounter a few bugs now and then, etc. etc.... None of these distract from the core experience of using magic in varied and creative ways. [b][i]And it's so much fun.[/i][/b]

I've seen and played a few "customize your own spells" games, and this one simply takes the cake. The spellcrafting system is straightforward and very intuitive to learn. Puzzles strewn around the world are tailored to almost all the runes/effects you're going to find, and the hint system is great to let you know if you've already got the required tools (and somewhere along the path, you might have enough tools in your arsenal to solve them in unexpected ways - and it's going to feel [i]great[/i]). The combat leaves enough room for you to win using vastly different setups, though enemies immune to multiple elements might make you feel frustrated at times.

I'm currently around 30%~40% progress, and even if the later parts of the game don't maintain the level of quality as the part I've seen so far, it will still be super fun (there will be more magic to find and more spells to craft - that will never be not fun), and worth every penny of the full price.

The devs seem to have plans to update the game for a while, so I'm looking forward to see the game improve in the near future. 

-------------

Un coup et vous vous retrouvez Ã  terre, parfois pile avec le bon timming pour vous en reprendre un juste derriÃ¨re et recommencer (encore merci aux dÃ©placement qui mettent quasi une seconde Ã  se lancer). Le manque de maniabilitÃ© du jeu est d'ailleurs sa seule source de difficultÃ© puisque mes seules morts (3 au total) ont eu lieu contre un boss qui jette des explosifs et oÃ¹ l'on se bat sur des plateformes rÃ©duites, ce qui empÃªche de manoeuvrer Ã  causes des chaussures en savon de l'hÃ©roÃ¯ne.

Je passe sur le niveau ultime de backtracking que propose le jeu. Visitez une fois la forÃªt et elle sera "sympa", visitez la cinq fois et vous connaÃ®trez par coeur son absence de textures.

Mais le systÃ¨me de magie !

Oui le systÃ¨me de magie est cool. C'est parfois utile de pouvoir changer ses sorts mais on finira trÃ¨s vite par programmer quatre sorts pour ne quasiment plus toucher au livre des sorts.

Pourquoi ?

Parce que sur le papier, c'est super cool de pouvoir faire des triples boules de feu rebondissantes qui, quand elles touches, dÃ©clenchent des Ã©boulements. Ca serait mieux si, dans les faits, vous pouviez en lancer plus de trois avant de vous retrouver Ã  court de mana et vous retrouver Ã  courir en rond autour des ennemis.

Les combats de boss sont d'ailleurs assez pitoyables puisque vous allez passer votre temps Ã  courir en rond en attendant que votre mana remonte, a esquiver les attaques pathÃ©tiques car molassones du boss.

Le seul point vraiment positif du jeu, ce sont les Ã©nigmes sous forme de dÃ©fi qui utilisent vraiment bien le systÃ¨eme de magie. Le hic, c'est que vous alles passer cinquante minutes de combat mou du genou et de backtracking pour moins de dix minutes d'Ã©nigme.

Pour terminer, j'aimerais vous parler du scÃ©nario et de l'univers Ã©crit par Ed Greenwood, juste pour vous dire qu'il n'a AUCUN intÃªret. C'est plat Ã  en mourir, les mÃ©chants ne sont pas en fait de vrais mÃ©chants sauf celui qui a une tÃªte de mÃ©chant. Les mentors restent chez eux Ã  rien branler pendant que vous sauvez le monde. L'histoire est convenue et le lore est chiant, simpliste et enfantin. Ca a clairement Ã©tÃ© pensÃ© pour des enfants mais mÃªme dans cette optique, Ã§a reste totalement oubliable.

A n'acheter que si vous n'avez rien Ã  faire et que le prix descend Ã  dix euros ou moins.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997046452', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1991, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1980, 'last_played': 1496110603}
review:
Fabulous game.  Spell creation is really intuitive and fun, and it lets you do a lot of exciting things, like self-multiplying random firing spells that propagate continuously until you run out of magic.  The world is very vibrant and colourful and fun to run around blowing up with magic.  It's very Zelda-esque, with a lot to discover.

The puzzles are all pretty good.  Camera is at fixed angles, so you're never left missing things that you should see.  They take a reasonable amount of thought without ever being frustrating.  I suspect someone who is like, hardcore into puzzle gaming probably won't be that engaged, but otherwise I found them fun to solve.  There's too many "light all the torches in X seconds" puzzles though.

Has some problems, and I really love a lot about this game, so I hate saying that.

The bosses suck.  Just completely suck.  They LOOK awesome, but they're boring, bog-standard latter-day Zelda bosses.  Expose glowing weak point, attack glowing weak point, repeat until dead.  Then there's some that DON'T follow that pattern, but go down like chumps.  So that's pretty disappointing; I've stopped dodging most of the time, as I can usually just stand there and spam my best attacks.

Dungeons and general progression in the game are/is pretty formulaic.  You will require an element from the previous dungeon to progress in the next one, and that's a little disheartening.  I feel it would have benefitted a lot with a more open design that allowed you to build your own solutions to problems, rather than putting solid barriers in your path that say "you must have X element to proceed."  Something like Zelda 1 where you are just in the world and so are all the things you want to do and get but in no specific sequence, would have been perfect.  Or like Zelda 3 where the plot happens in intervals but how and when you get to those intervals is up to you.

My one problem with the puzzles is that a lot of the minor ones (that is, puzzles which don't bar your progression in the game) can be solved without the "correct" solution, but it's never creatively.  That is to say, I've never solved a puzzle I shouldn't have been able to solve by doing some quirky trick with a new spell, but I HAVE solved a lot of puzzles by spamming random bouncing fireballs that proc more random bouncing fireballs.  It's funny the first couple of times, but it's not much of an accomplishment.  Compare this with a Metroid game where I can get an item early by figuring out how to do angled bomb jumps or mockballing or some other clever trick.

So what it boils down to is there's a beautiful set up that lets you be super creative with all this magic... and then the world doesn't really give you an opportunity to excersize that creativity beyond how you choose to annihilate full screens of enemies.  Instead, you progress through a very linear series of dungeons and plot events with very clear solutions reliant on the most basic of your spells.

But in spite of all that, it's a super fun, amazing game, and I highly recommend it.

review:
I'm not the kind of guy that play single player games, my friend showed me the spell crafting system and i decided to test it. I tried to push it as far as i can go and before i knew it i had 15 hrs in the game and a lot of fun. I've completed the game in 18 hrs total. The story is amazing, graphic are perfect for the type of gameplay.

Cant wait for new content.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976488713', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1495508604}
review:
I recommend the game â€“ because I realise that most gamers either do have game pads or are comfortable with the WASD keys. It looks good and I wanted to know more about the world and its people even though I only played 15 minutes or so.    But for me it was time for a refund.

I didn't notice any warning that you should use a controller to play the game.  The game looks great and I love the idea of the games spell system.  But there was no way to remap keys that I could find.  I don't use WASD keys to play game nor do I use gamepads.  I gave it a go on the WASD keys - and the game is engaging - but I just couldn't adapt to play and ended up walking off cliffs etc.
So, itâ€™s a thumbs up from me â€“ but a warning to older gamers like myself or left handed players who like to reconfigure the keys.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004428529', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1859, 'last_played': 1653364124}
review:
Here's the deal, 

I've played 18 hours to complete 100% of the game that include the marvelous story, the very creative puzzle and all the achivement steam.

I enjoyed every seconds of that game. Don't get me wrong, i'm a competitive player 99% of my game are multiplayer climbing the aldders. But this one here is a gem. A must play, the very moment you will discoer how to build one spell correctly you will be amazed, but then you just scratch the surface. 

The complexity of a spell can be to the limit of your mana + wand one spell can litteraly include 5 spell repeating themself over and over until you are out of mana... but the room will be completely clear.

This is the first time i ever take time to post a review on steam, and this game worth my time ! Thanks to the team behind the game it is a game i will play for many years from time to time!

author: {'steamid': '76561198068450779', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1495503096}
review:
Okay first of all WOW ! 

I dont usually review games but this one is amazing ! The spell system is so well designed, complex yet easy to use. The music is so REMARKABLE ! The graphics are cute and the story goes along whit the cutness but it's not too deep just enough to keep you entertained and motivated. Can't wait to have more time to put in this baby.

It's a pearl.

author: {'steamid': '76561198345498807', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 7142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2276, 'last_played': 1647478469}
review:
I really like this game.
This is the first game that I have found that that combines magic and programming. It  is More than worth the cost. I do wish the storyline was a little longer, but that is minor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042556071', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 677, 'last_played': 1495471364}
review:
This is a really good game for the price it sold for. Great little story about a mage. The graphics are really nice considering it was made with Unity. They totally fit the story and genre of the game.  The best feature of the game is it's amazing spellcrafting mechanics (I have yet to find all runes, maybe in my second playthrough), but it has some really great puzzles to solve and good character development.

The only downside of the game is the missing voice acting (I hate reading a lot in games), but considering the price, I can live without it. Might be a nice DLC option ;).

author: {'steamid': '76561198049779488', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 939, 'last_played': 1514557334}
review: æ£’ï¼ï¼ï¼éå¸¸ä¸é”™ï¼ï¼ï¼æœ‰åˆ›æ„ï¼ï¼è€Œä¸”ä¸é™åˆ¶åˆ›æ„

author: {'steamid': '76561197965193277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1497211661}
review:
After 2 hours I must admit I'm quite hooked!

The gameplay - at first a bit repetitive - is starting to sound promising as new Behaviors / Augments are unlocked: I really want to reach the point I will be able to craft complex spells.

The interface for crafting / renaming spells and switching between different spells of a same category is well made and for the first time I feel like I can adapt my playstyle dynamically to different types of situations, which is pretty new and cool to me ^^

The content seems there: I have already beaten 2 bosses, collected a few new spells, a few major collectibles there are still many places for me to explore.

The music is nice too and totally fits with the action as well as with the more peaceful moments.

The only things that I'm less fan is the storytelling: I'm not particularly amazed by the Mr Greenwood performance and the way characters talk to each others using barks isn't very statisfying to me.

All in all I would recommend this game: it's solid in terms of gameplay and quite refreshing while featuring this kind of "old-zelda" flavour that touches my heart.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046476671', 'num_games_owned': 286, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1584, 'last_played': 1503502530}
review:
Bought this game on impulse, and it was absolutely excellent.

The spellcrafting system is actually interesting and purposeful, with all the spells you can make being functionally different. Most games centered around this sort of thing will still only have a few /functionally/ different spells, with the only real difference being stats, but not this one.

You can make spells loop in on themselves, and add modifying runes like size or time onto various other runes to change their properties. I found myself spellcrafting constantly, not just to have fun and mess around but also to modify my setup for the present situation. By the end of the game, I utterly annihilated the final boss, which felt a bit cheap, but at the same time it was very satisfying seeing how powerful i had become through my creativity, which is kind of the point.

Completed it to 100% in 22~ hours, and am left wanting more. Short and sweet, it was worth the money, and I'm proud to have supported the developers. As of this review, there are also only 5 negative reviews, and they are all chinese players disappointed by the chinese translation. So unless you're chinese, this game is 100% recommended by anyone who has played it :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197973269902', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 570, 'last_played': 1495427435}
review: Don't be fooled by the low rating on steam reviews, If you check the negative reviews currently, there are none, unless you are chinese, it's a bad translation from what I saw.  But if you are not playing the game in chinese it's Fantastic, I loved every second of this game.  That said, I felt like it was a little short, Just when I began to understand the spell crafting to a point where I was making great spells, the game was over.  I hope there will be an expansion or sequel to this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053928834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 688, 'last_played': 1586561104}
review:
I'm not going to be too detailed here. Not yet anyway, as I still want to finish the game. 
So let me just start by saying that I love this game, and nearly everything about it. Right from the start I was grabbed by it, not to say I'm a hard mark(I'm probably not) but to say that there is so much that I find captivating about it. The music is the first thing you get to experience and it is anything but lackluster, the puzzles made me stop and think(again, probably not that hard) and the world is beautiful. 
I wanted to mention this last because I think it is the most important aspect of this game; the spellcrafting. The spellcrafting is an extraordinary system imo as it allows you to tailor make spells for any situation and encourages exactly that through it's combat and puzzles. It has so much potential as a mechanic and I've ALWAYS played mages before other classes in games for their flashy magic. Let me just say that this did not at all disappoint me.

Now for fairness sake I will say there are a few parts that fell a bit short; the story isn't 100% engaging(to where I am in the game), there isn't any (real) voice acting throughout the game(so for the most part I just did it myself XD), the characters aren't all too memorable, the enemies are a fair bit too predictable. 

This kind of gameplay makes me want to love everything about the game but I can't currently say I do, however these are small things in an indie like this and I would LOVE to see an expansion on this solid effort and beautiful piece of art.

Just to end this off I would like to put a more in depth review of the things I loved and didn't but I'll leave that till the end. Either way, for anyone that loves to be creative, watch things blow up, or is just a fan of throwing fire; this game is worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968646806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 993, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 993, 'last_played': 1495631090}
review:
Well, I "completed" the game in about 14 hours and I went pretty quick so 15-20 hours I guess is about what completion will average, which is pretty good for a game in this price range. 
It's important to note however that I'm at less than 70% completion on my savegame so I got more stuff to find and figure out how to get to.
Good fun and lots more to discover and several of the kickstarter stretch goals like Archmage mode, hardcore mode and speed run are not even implemented yet. Recommended!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198019645318', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1496008632}
review:
A very delightful "feel-good-game" so far. Haven't played that much yet but I really enjoyed the first 1,5 hours of it. Great soundtrack and comic style, fluid graphics. Controls are also on spot. I haven't played Magicka to which it is compared in some comments, so the spell crafting aspect is new to me - and I have to admit I like it. 
It's a bit zeldaesk but a tiny bit more casual I'd say. Plus it reminds me of Fable as far as the cheerful atmosphere is concerned. Still MoM surely has its own character and I'll definitely go on playing it. 
I've also started playing S.T.A.L.K.E.R again (which is one of my favourite three titles of all time) and this gem appears to be just the right counterweight to the dark eastern european despair:)
So if you like to be drawn into a fairy-tale-world and/or experimenting with magic powers and enjoy neat puzzles: go for it.
Actually there's no reason not to love this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198388796970', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 675, 'last_played': 1628991145}
review:
Adorando a historia, jogabilidade e sua construÃ§Ã£o no geral. Com toda a certza oque maims chama a tenÃ§Ã£o Ã© o sistema de magias e suas variaÃ§Ãµes incriveis, coisas que nÃ£o vemos em jogos "triplo A", essa industria esta precisando dessas grandes ideias e ousadas, que com a experiencia dos grandes desenvolvedores podem chegar aos niveis atuais de sÃ©ries como The Legend of Zelda (no atual Breath of the Wild), uma obra-prima.

O jogo tem tudo para ter uma sequencia poderosa e com muito mais, de tudo que tem de bom, e melhorar no que deixou na esccala mÃ©dia.

E que venham mais jogos com esse sabor de aventura magica, que carentes por isso, nÃ³s estamos.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987033201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1496087186}
review:
Great game. Storyline is relatively cliche but fun, while adding in a few elements I thought were reasonably unique. While there is quite a bit of backtracking, the gameplay is solid and some of the puzzles will leave you scratching your head for a few minutes trying to figure out which spells you need to design to optimally complete them. You can suboptimally complete them as well, but it will be more difficult and/or take several attempts. So far it hasn't given me any trouble.

The real strength of this game is the spellcrafting system though. You start out with some basic spells which are fairly generic, and your first few runes start giving you very mundane things. ("Woo, firebolt. Oh, oh wait now it's *homing* firebolt.") Yet, after you get a bit through the game you start being able to combine and chain spells and add different modifiers and contigent triggers that your spells start getting very complex and incredibly fun to experiment with. This really makes the game unique, and aside from Magicka (which still didn't really have fully customizable spells), I can't think of anything that approaches it in that regard.

8.5/10, Short and rough in places, but with unique mechanics. Very enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089404117', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2505, 'last_played': 1496883838}
review: I love the gameplay, especially the spellcrafting involved in creating your spells. It adds an additional dimension to just throwing preset spells, and allowing you to customize what you want your spells to actually do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014755378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 952, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 952, 'last_played': 1495517232}
review:
A smart and delightful zelda-like adventure that feels like a polished and well crafted experience. Puzzle and area design are well thought out, and the spell-crafting system is both intuitive and deep, allowing you to craft your own experiences and solutions to puzzles. The game does a good job of introducing you to it, and then slowly creating more complex scenarios for you to solve. This in turn makes you a better spell-caster and allows for a more strategical approach to combat as you start fighting more difficult monsters.

I'm 6 hours in and haven't completed half of the map. The game encourages exploration and experimentation, allowing for  you to return to previous location in order to unlock areas you may not have had access to with a more limited set of spell modifiers.

All in all - so far - an absolutely delightful experience. I hope more users post reviews to help get this game some attention.

author: {'steamid': '76561198364336916', 'num_games_owned': 635, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 1529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1391, 'last_played': 1495751259}
review: I saw this game on Kickstarter, and was blown away by the art style and that the game looked to offer somethign different. Im not a massive RPG fan but this has a great combination of action, puzzles, collectables, bosses and the spell system is intuitive. I thought initially it might get a bit confusing with the spells because I dont usually play these style of games but it explains how they work, and I was creating my own spells in no time. Thats what differentiates this from other adventure games and it works really well. It also looks beautiful in 4K. Highly Recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198076198605', 'num_games_owned': 2040, 'num_reviews': 512, 'playtime_forever': 875, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 875, 'last_played': 1495753636}
review:
La verdad que solo puedo decir cosas buenas de este juego, llevo unas cuantas horas jugadas y cuanto mas juego mas me gusta.

Graficamente es precioso y de mecanicas muy simples, sobretodo el combate, hay que ir muy a lo loco para morir pero eso no le quita interes al juego, ya que sus mecanicas son excelentes, lo mejor de todo es la configuracion de los conjuros, tenemos cuatro conjuros basicos que nos los enseÃ±an y luego segun vayamos explorando encontramos runas que alteran la funcion de esos hechizos y las combinaciones son muchas y es el jugador el que decide como alterar dichos hechizos.

El juego esta repleto de puzzles, tanto para abrir puertas, deberemos crear una dibujo con varias piezzas que nos dan, como para desbloquear cofres haciendo uso de los hechizos y sus modificaciones para activar unos faros en un tiempo limite.

Os dejo un link del primer gameplay pero vendran mas:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WLcHdErrMPs&index=4&list=PLPsIZqp3c64iaRdDJvPcwPPJDo1jwABYc

Para acabar dire que es un juego que cuanto mas avanzas en la historia mas engancha.

Darle una oportunidad

review:
Beautiful art style, intriguing puzzles and game play.  The games core mechanic of swapping out runes to create new spells is absolutely fascinating.  None of the spells over stay their welcome, and are instead quickly added to with new runes to create new and fun spells.

Great game,! definitly watching this dev for future titles!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994151814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1495506005}
review: I am still early in game (2.5h in) but I can tell that this game is exactly my type! I already unlocked super cool spells and modifiers and in a good pace (not feeling overwhelmed). The visuals are vivid and the fantasy story feel is real. I play with a controller as suggested and the gameplay is nice and intuitive. I strongly recommend this title if you are a fan of classic RPGs story based with puzzles and you will get the spell crafting on top. Happy Gaming!

author: {'steamid': '76561198013201539', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 812, 'last_played': 1504739596}
review:
A gorgeous graphic style and a very accessible learning curve make the first part of this game a delight.
Which is a good thing, because I had an horrendous system crash which corrupted my save file so I have had to play it all over again...  And it's still fun.
Once you start constructing spells and understanding how the system has been designed to give flexibility but not unlimited power, it becomes even more fun.  The early boss battles are well-judged: a strong reminder of Zelda in terms of their smart design and balance.
Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115485079', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1515684827}
review:
8 heures dedans, pas encore atteint les 50%, et le jeu me prends completement.
J'adore la libertÃ© totale pour les sorts, les dÃ©cors sont beaux, la musique est classe et bien adaptÃ© au jeu, les enemis variÃ©s, et les stratÃ©gies d'attaque sont bien rÃ©compensÃ©es (je veux dire que la mÃ©thode la plus bourrin n'est pas souvent la meilleure, mÃªme si parfois, elle sert bien).

Seuls points nÃ©gatifs pour moi : les chemins d'accÃ¨s aux zones ne sont pas forcÃ©ment trÃ¨s bien indiquÃ©s, certaines Ã©preuves ont des timings un peu courts, et il reste de trois bugs de gameplay gÃªnants (de ce que j'en ai vu, il faut Ãªtre bien malchanceux pour les avoir, mourir en tuant un boss de donjon, par exemple), mais ils ne bloquent pas la progression, au pire ils empÃªchent la collecte d'un item.

Dans l'ensemble, un bon jeu, bien fait, mais peut-Ãªtre un peu cher, j'aurais dit que 15 Ã  18 euros auraient Ã©tÃ©s un prix plus juste.

review:
Great game so far with really good combat and spellcasting. I kinda feel like I'm playing Ys The Ark of Napishtim, which is no bad thing. Thoroughly recommend it, it's great fun.
Edit here: I don't know how people are completing it so quickly, 18 hours and I still haven't seen all areas and there are still sections I haven't got to in the areas I have explored.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102420246', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1495252807}
review:
Bought this game even though its a bit high for my steam purchases.

So far so good. I have not yet run into any major bugs and the game pad interfaces well. I would say the game that I played previously that this one most resembles was an old PC/Dreamcast release called Silver.

Other positive reviews will give you a better idea of the pros and cons so I won't waste time writing them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045288749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1596347179}
review:
This game makes me feel conflicted.

The music is enjoyable, and very fitting. It is, however, forgettable. Good nonetheless.

The story is really boring and typical. Evil king, mages are persecuted, go save the world or something. The game ends on a needless cliffhanger, even though the game already feels a bit short on story content.

Visually, the game is quite nice. It has the typical cel-shaded Unity game look without looking lazy or bad. It actually is kinda nice. The shadows look kind of bad in some spots, but the game look really good in general.

The real point of the game, however, is to craft and cast spells. And this is the part of the game that makes me feel conflicted. There is a fair amount you can do with the spellcrafting system, and that is the part that I love. But the part that I don't like is that there is no real reason to actually come up with creative spells. In a weird way, the game falls flat in terms of both combat and puzzles, but it succeeds in the spellcasting system itself.

So the combat fails for one main reason. The only thing that really matters in combat, besides blocking and dodging, is dealing tons of damage, and there isn't a lot of creative ways to do that. Sure, you can create a rotating image of yourself that shoots out homing projectiles, but why do that when you can create projectiles that shoot out projectiles that shoot out projectiles and so on? Pretty much every combat encounter in the game can be solved by creating these recursive spells that just annihilate everything until you run out of mana. Even the last boss was a joke, with every phase of the fight ending with a single press of the right mouse button. But in a way, the combat was kind of enjoyable. There was something fun about watching my spells destroy everything in the room and lagging out my game. Just seeing how much mayhem I could cause with a single spell was fun in a way. But it leaves me wishing that the spellcasting system was a bit better tuned and that the game found a better way to actually challenge my spellcrafting abilites.

Puzzles kind of have the same problem. Pretty much every puzzle at first was solved by me dashing around and shooting projectiles in quick succession with some exceptions like logic puzzles involving creating statues of yourself and putting them on buttons. But the story puzzles never really challenged me in any meaningful way. I also went out to find all of the spell components to see if those puzzles were any better, but they were solved in mostly the same way, and the teleport component further trivializes the puzzles. In a way, it was kind of fun to solve the puzzles in an unintended way when the game tells me that I may not have the proper components to do so, but I really wish that they would make their puzzles actually require me to be creative.

And that is the main issue I have with the game, and the reason why I can only recommend this game if you are really in love with the idea of creating spells. There is never really any reason to utilize all the different components. In my opinion, the game should have given you all of the elements and most of the components early, and then forced you to actually use these components in a creative way to actually progress through the game. But as is stands, you can beat the game without most of the components (quite easily, in fact), you unlock the elements in the last stretch of the game, and you can kill all the enemies by just creating spells that continue to just create themselves. The game feels like it has done the job of fleshing out the underlying mechanics, but not done the job of actually giving you a reason to use them. So I had fun with this game, but I was left a bit unsatisfied.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977487712', 'num_games_owned': 1608, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 477, 'last_played': 1495459797}
review:
Review is of the first 7 hours of the game (up to first "aura")
Lots of exploring was done and always felt like I was finding something new to do without having to push the story forward.  Over all the experience feels extremely polished gameplay feel.  Have been told more content patches are on the way (more difficulties, speedrun mode, ect.) as well.

A note - Was playing at 1280x720 windowed using Borderless Gaming.  No AA (Anti Aliasing) setting in game and had to force it in the Nvidia settings (been told there will be a patch for it soon).

Pros
 - Expansive spell crating system
 - Lots of extras hidden
 - Great mood music that fits
 - Puzzles all around! (They even tell you if you have what is needed to beat it - Could still beat them even when it ways you don't have everything)


Cons
 - A bit slow to start
 - Dialog that slows pace game down
 - Keyboard can be clumsy for movement [only have WADA] (Controller is very preferred)

author: {'steamid': '76561197997817748', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1661, 'last_played': 1543535451}
review:
Very nice game. But be warned, it's short. I completed the main story in a bit less than 12 hours.
Without being particularly fast.
The side content is worth a few more hours of gameplay (let's say around 5) if you do it on your own, without looking for answers over the net.
Also, it's near unplayable with a mouse/keyboard combination. You'll definitely need a pad.

</end of warnings>

It's a very fun and interesting game, though. The spell system rocks. Also there are a few additional modes of gameplay comining, which should improve it's lifespan a bit.

And truth to tell, I enjoyed playing it a whole lot. So it's definitely a thumb up!

author: {'steamid': '76561198021446031', 'num_games_owned': 335, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1495342582}
review: Having a lot of fun with this game. Beautiful graphics, great music, so far the puzzles don't make me want to slam my head against the wall. The magic is a lot of fun. I love being able to create my spells. I can't wait to see what spell pieces will fall into my hands next. The gameplay is a bit like old zelda; run around, kill goblins, solve puzzles, etc. I'm having a blast.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047427143', 'num_games_owned': 861, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2496, 'last_played': 1591300569}
review:
Really good!   So far the spell mechanics are really interesting and so far many different types of puzzles with a good story.

Add-on: 
After completing the game, for what it is, it is a rather interesting game.   The puzzle mechanics go throughout the game.  The fighting can be rather weak at times but that is also due to the spell crafting system which there are so many variation and chains that you can do to make your own unique spell for your own fight style.   I like the fact that challenges are well hidden to where you can miss something just waking by it several times it is so well blended into the scenery.

If you like puzzles and looking for the little hidden bits in a game, try this game.   It is not long play but took me around 20 hours to complete it with almost all achievements.   It could be completed without all that in about 10 or so.  But for about $2 an hour entertainment, this is a good choice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095213036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 986, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1495959253}
review: Lovely little game, so far.  Charming, with a very interesting magic system.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008594671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 785, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 740, 'last_played': 1667565823}
review: If you're looking for something fresh and different, check this one out!   In my opinion, the art direction, the storyline and the unique spellcrafting system are just amazing!

author: {'steamid': '76561197989487702', 'num_games_owned': 1927, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1495382653}
review:
Very nice and polished game. It has somewhat simple graphics but a nice story and good puzzles.
The highlight is definitely the spell-construction. There are a 4 basic spell types and a ton of runes to modify them. The spells can even be chained together with specific runes. It's a very versatile and cool system. 
The game has a bit of a metroidvania vibe since you can get into more zones, the more runes you find. A lot of them are optional and hidden behind puzzles or challenges.
The combat is a well made. There are even interesting boss-battles. One complaint here is that the quickselect menu to swtich out spells doesn't pause the game. Also there are occationally issues with getting the spells to aim at the right enemy. 
This game is developed with controller in mind and works really well with that.
Overall a clear recommendation

author: {'steamid': '76561198026457361', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 808, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 808, 'last_played': 1493446756}
review: Really enjoy this game. One of the best games that I've bought in a while. It's quite interesting what you can make your spells do based on how you arrange the symbol connections.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024993388', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1493687986}
review:
This indie game is pretty dang awesome. I have found myself disappointed every time "life" makes me have to sign off. I've only played about 15% of the game contents, but it's been great so far!

The adaptability of the spell creation is fantastic. This is reason alone to buy the game. I can create the spells I want and play how I'd want to be a mage. You start with a basic set of three spells, then unlock modifiers to make those spells do other things like adding movement or direction, or chaining spells together. The unlock rate is a great balance between keeping you interested/excited about the next unlock & not overwhelming you by drowning you in modifiers. My personal favorite thus fireball with an explosion when it hits something :)

Graphics are cutesy & fit in great with the style of game play. It's a mix of rpg feel with a puzzle game thrown in. The puzzles work really well to increase your creativity with spells creation. Certain puzzles require certain spell combos to complete. It's nice too to have an in game "cheat" option, where hints can be provided at the cost of orbs (currency). So if you're super stuck just murder some badies & use the loot for a hint. I also like the first hint free mechanic on all puzzles which tells you if you have the spell components necessary to solve the puzzle. Very much appreciated.

Gameplay does feel a bit restricted in that the games does guide you where you need to go. But I'm finding there are some areas that need to be revisited to complete the next step, so perhaps that will continue to improve as I get further in the game.

Overall, a good game, with amazing game mechanics, bosses, and a storyline.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968929860', 'num_games_owned': 382, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1588, 'last_played': 1645400375}
review:
TL;DR: Zelda Mages. Great soundtrack, fluid combat, challenging puzzles, tons of secrets.

I am one of the Kickstarter backers and have been playing since Beta. Through the beta it was amazing to see the devs take the advice of the community and continually update the game and its mechanics from the feedback.

I use a keyboard/mouse to play and the game functioned well. Things moved/aimed as I expected them to. This game was designed with consoles in mind so it has very good controller support, but it is definitely NOT a console port.

Gameplay feels fluid, puzzles ahead show you how to use abilities you had previously discovered. Sound and music is very suitable to the environment. In combat, you can [i]feel[/i] the impact of your spells. It makes for a VERY immersive game.

Puzzles range widely in difficulty from very easy to quite difficult. It makes you think outside of the box on what to do with your spells.

Designing spells is very intuitive. Shapes function as you'd expect with a few surprises here and there. The only limit is your imagination. Making spells even feels like it has purpose. Not all shapes can fit in all patterns, which means to make that ultimate spell of destruction, you have to figure out HOW to make it first.

One issue I have is that it feels a bit short. Two more game modes are being added, So I'm fairly certain that issue will resolve itself. Progress through the game is constant so you will keep discovering new items, spell runes, and puzzles right up to the end of the game.

I will be live with this game frequently at www.YouTube.com/Mattmon if you'd like to see it first hand.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035363122', 'num_games_owned': 282, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1149, 'last_played': 1495390873}
review:
FÃ¼r mich ist Mages of Mystralia eigentlich nicht "das" Spiel, welches ich mir normalerweise holen wÃ¼rde. Allerdings suchte ich gerade nach "was neuem". Und ein anderes Spiel erschien mir nicht interessant genug.

Mein Ersteindruck:
Vom Stil her wÃ¼rde ich meinen, es hat ein wenig von "Diablo" was die KÃ¤mpfe betrifft (Ohne das hierbei GegenstÃ¤nde fallen) und im Gamedesign etwas von Zelda. Die Aufgaben waren bisher simpel: "Hier von drei" oder "Hole davon vier" also nichts besonderes. Interessant scheint mir dagegen, das weitere RÃ¤tselaufgaben durch "Zaubern und Nachdenken" zu lÃ¶sen sind, was mir soweit gut gefÃ¤llt, ebenso wie das vielversprechende Zaubersystem des Spiels. Aja, und die zwei bisherigen "Boss-KÃ¤mpfe" waren fÃ¼r mich zwar einfach, aber dennoch in Grafik & Animation & Idee gut gemacht.

Positiv:
+ Grafik ist schÃ¶n und liebevoll gestaltet.
+ Sound & Musik (Gesprochen wird nicht, der Text aber durch "Gemurmel" etc. betont)
+ Technisch lÃ¤uft es auf meinem betagten Rechner prima
+ Gamepad problem konnte ich mit "x360ce" beheben

Negativ:
- Save points (Mit Ausnahme von Dark Souls mag ich die nicht).

Dieses "oben" nach ca. 120 Spielminuten. Und Fazit nach ca. 11 Stunden Spielzeit:

Gut! Bisher ist die Zaubermechanik wirklich interessant und das Spiel hat viele verschiedene Puzzles ebenso wie eine gute Geschichte.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079916553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1554558780}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971873203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1498813868}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198006793821', 'num_games_owned': 228, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 773, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 730, 'last_played': 1526841956}
review:
A really fun game. 

+ The soundtrack, soooo good. 
+ The Artstyle give a good ambience.
+ The spell system is what make this game different and they nailed it!

- A bit short and too easy for my taste. At the same time, it's the first game from this studio.
- Some aspect of the story are left unexplored when they are intriguing.

I supported the Kickstarter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016256449', 'num_games_owned': 293, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4443, 'last_played': 1624752782}
review:
PROS
+++ Very creative level design that turns small areas into good dungeon delving experience.
+++ That soundtrack... That soundtrack.
++ Beautiful worldbuilding, deep and compelling lore.
++ Fast-paced, dynamic.
++ Interesting spellcasting system.
+ Compelling character, even with few dialogue lines.
+ Overall soothing and immersive experience.
+ Great completionist experience.

CONS
- Well... it's easy. Really easy. Hopefully the future game modes will fix that.
- Very short game experience.
- NPCs interaction somehow leaves to be desired.
- Some very intresting NPCs are not fully explored.
- The plot somehow falls a bit short by the end.

OVERALL
Although the narrative experience falls a bit short of expectations, the game by itself is a wonder of exploration, puzzle-solving and goblin battling. Even tho MoM's influences are plain there to see, the game offers something fresh. It sits in perfect balance over a leisurely cruise through a magical universe and a compelling gaming experience of wits and reflexes.

Supported in Kickstarter, would buy again.
